I am very apologetic that the staff member you questioned about area attractions failed to provide you with the information that includes over 200 major retail stores in the immediate area, the long list of entertainment venues including theatres, concerts, dining establishments, and of course, within minutes of some of the most beautiful beaches in Southern California and not too far from Disneyland, California Adventure, the Anaheim Angels baseball stadium, and a long list of other attractions, all within 45 minutes.    Our in-room literature also lists many of the area attractions, (but a brochure rack is no longer used in many hotels due to the material quickly becoming outdated and unsightly).  In terms of the Internet charges, like most full service hotels around the country, we do charge a nominal daily fee for Internet usage and are continually reassessing the charge to insure it is correct and competitive. Please be assured our fee is below our comparable competition and we do offer complimentary Internet accessibility in the lobby area.    Though we receive many daily compliments about guest service that exceeds expectation, obviously we failed in this situation. I am truly apologetic we missed this opportunity to impress you.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier

Summary: This is a great hotel with terrific staff. The hotel has a shuttle to SNA airport and is located less then 300 meters from great shopping and restaurants. The rooms are very clean and the beds seem very new. For those that like to run, the bike/jog path in Newport Beach is only 3 miles away. It is an easy run from the hotel 12 miles to the beach and back.  I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Sean A:   On behalf of the staff and myself, thank you for noting some of the amenities the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa offers our guests. Having just completed an extensive refresh of much of the hotel, with more on the way, we are striving to provide Southern California visitors the best in services, guest rooms, and location.    With the best in retail shopping within a five mile radius; near a diversity of restaurants and entertainment;all the major business centers in the area, as well as some of the most beautiful beaches on the Newport Coast, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa is the best choice for business or leisure travelers.   Thank you once again. We hope you come back soon!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier

Summary: Accommodations were clean, beds very comfortable, food is good, bar is excellent, as well as the pool. Missing a Business Center/Data Center to print out boarding passes or documents. Otherwise, convenient location for the Newport Beach area.
Manager Response: Dear Gloria A:    Thank you for your review. We appreciate your notice of the great location, near so much in the area- shopping, restaurants, entertainment, beaches, and all the major business centers. And, of course, John Wayne Orange County Airport is close by, but far enough away for us to not feel like an "airport hotel".    We've done a lot to bring the hotel forward with upgraded, well appointed  accommodations and our beautiful new Concierge Lounge. In the near future, our new and technologically advanced Business Center will delight and surprise our guests with its many features. Please come back and see it and more in the coming months.   Once again, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,   Rob A Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: A great business hotel close to freeway and amenities
Summary: Stayed at this hotel a few times over the last 5 years as a base for Costa mesa. An older hotel, but well maintained, clean and professional/helpful staff.  The rooms are also a good size and well laid out,and never had an issue with cleanliness etc.  There are two kinds of room that i have stayed in. the front rooms tend to be larger and overlook the main road. The others are at the back, and are slightly smaller bt have a balcony and sliding door - though they do overlook the multilevel car park.  One word of warning - get a room at the end of the corridor and away from the lifts as you can hear a lot of noise from the lifts and corridors.   The restauarnt and bar is very good with good choice of food. As you are on bristol street though, there are literally dozens of various
Manager Response: Dear Steve H:   Thank you for being a happy, loyal Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa guest. On behalf of the staff, I'm happy to hear how much you enjoy our hotel, as well as everything the area offers- shopping, great restaurants, a wide range of entertainment, convenience to the area business centers, and so much more!   Once again, our sincere appreciation for your consideration and great review. We look forward to your return soon!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: We used this hotel as our base for a quick OC getaway.  We were upgraded to executive level which offered snacks in the afternoon and an excellent breakfast.  Rooms were nice and quiet.  Bed was okay not great (can't all Hilton's use Doubletree beds?)  Staff was friendly.  Downstairs bar/lounge area was comfortable to catch a game or relax after a day on the go.  Pool area was refreshing but our last summer day was crowded with a group that decided the Palm tree planters were a good diving board.  Good hotel for the rate and enjoyable with an upgrade.
Manager Response: Dear Spi_kids_LA:   Thank you for taking the time to review the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. I'm so sorry you didn't enjoy our new Hilton Serenity Beds, Hilton's most upgraded hotel bed product. Our guests have been very welcoming of the comfort of the bed. I'm so glad you enjoyed the Bristol Palm lounge area and some other amenities the Hilton offers our guests.   Summertime is a great escape for families to enjoy all the area offers and we're so happy to host so many family events from June through August here at Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. Thank you for letting us know that we need to move some things around at the pool to discourage those not being thoughtful (or even smart) about their conduct in the pool area. I'm sure if the staff had witnessed what you saw or if they'd been told about it, corrective action would have occurred immediately.   Once again, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Great place to stay, rooms are spacious and comfortable. I went with a group of people and the factilities were excellent and the location was great. The staff were friendly and helpful especially when it came to booking restaurants. I would certaintly recomend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in orange county.
Manager Response: Dear Liam S:   Thank you for your review and for noting that our guest rooms are spacious and that we offer such a convenient location. We've recently completed an extensive redo of much of the hotel, adding great new amenities including the concierge lounge.    With close proximity to so much the area offers including great restaurants, beautiful beaches, a wide selection of shopping and entertainment venues; within minutes of all the major business centers and convenience to Orange County John Wayne Airport, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa Airport is the best choice for Southern California visitors for business or leisure.   Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.     Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I'm Hilton diamond.... I stayed here a few months back and it was only ok- average.     But being diamond this time I was on the 7th floor and its got a very nice shower.  Room overall is above average and it's got a great bathroom.    The normal rooms were just ok.  So clearly they need to upgrade the other rooms to this level.
Manager Response: Dear Markos314:   On behalf of the staff, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. I appreciate that you've noticed the upgrades we've made. I'm not sure when your last stay was, but all guest accommodations at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa have been upgraded through-out. And, while our well appointed guests baths are always positively commented on, some of our rooms do offer a shower only. I'm happy to hear you approve!   Thank you once again and we hope you'll be returning soon.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: 2nd time staying at Costa Mesa and again very pleased with staff & room.  Wonderfully quiet room and pleasant amenities.  Loved that the door could be opened for natural air and there was lots of dresser space for a 2 week stay.
Manager Response: Dear Carolscarol:   I am so pleased to hear you enjoyed a long stay with us recently and that your guest accommodations were satisfactory. Our guest rooms are considered some of the most spacious, well appointed in the area and the balconies (while not having beautiful Hawaiian views) do offer fresh air and some Californian sunsets that are spectacular.   Our close proximity to so much the area offers-restaurants, shopping, entertainment, beaches, and all the major business centers is an asset our travelers enjoy for business or for leisure.   Once again, thank you for your review and for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.   Mahalo,   Rob A. Gauthier

Summary: great place to stay, friendly, clean, accommodating to large groups.   Valet was friendly and helpful and most nights large groups of people went into the bar and stayed late.  The staff was more than willing to take care of us and didn't mind the late night noise.
Manager Response: Dear Franci S:   We'll so happy to hear you enjoyed your recent stay. It's our goal to go above and beyond and I'm pleased to hear you felt that during your visit with us. I will pass on your great comments to the staff.   With close proximity to so much the area offers including great restaurants, beautiful beaches, a wide selection of shopping and entertainment venues; within minutes of all the major business centers and convenience to Orange County John Wayne Airport, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa Airport is the best choice for Southern California visitors for business or leisure.   Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.     Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Very friendly and helpful staff.  Front desk service was excellent as we left our bankcard at a local restaurant and they went out of their way to help us relocate it.  Would definately stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Traci M:   I am so happy to hear we were of assistance when your bankcard went missing. As the general manager, I am continually proud of the staff here at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa; this is another example of the many compliments our associates receive about their commitment to go above and beyond for our guests.  Thank you for taking the time to provide your comments! We look forward to your return in the near future.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I had booked a one-night stay several months ago.  Even then, only rooms with a single king bed were available.  Since I was travelling with a friend, I kept checking to see if any double bedded rooms had become available.  I even called the hotel twice with a request to switch to a room with two beds.  Upon checking in, the front desk rep apologized that the hotel was sold out due to the water polo competition and that he couldn't give me a room with two beds.  However, he offered us a one bedroom suite that had a hide-a-bed.  What a pleasant surprise!  The suite was newly renovated.  We especially appreciated the large bathroom that had both a tub and a separate shower stall.  The bathtub was nicely laid out with two separate sinks - one near the shower and the second one near
Manager Response: Dear bamboola:   It was our pleasure to be your host recently. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your comments and on behalf of the staff, we appreciate that you enjoyed the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa and all that it offers.    With our close proximity to so much that Southern California offers - business centers, a large selection of name brand shopping, beautiful beaches, numerous entertainment venues, and within minutes of the Orange County John Wayne Airport - the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa is a perfect choice for visitors, whether for business or leisure travel.   Thank you once again and come back soon.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier

Summary: Please don't stay here, staff will not paying any attention to your requests, got wrong food served, front desk needs to be reminded that they are in a hospitality business and paying attention to guest should be top most priority....this is very different hat other Hilton's I have stayed and I am a Hiltons Honnor members for over 10 years
Manager Response: Dear Trip Advisor Member:   I am truly apologetic you had a poor experience. I am unable to respond to the generalizations in your review other than to say that it seems your expectations were not initially met and it put your entire stay at the Hilton in a poor light. This is unacceptable as our reputation is to provide a high level of service in each area of the hotel. I am dismayed that your experience fell short of our typical excellent delivery of guest service and hope you will allow us another opportunity to demonstrate a more accurate experience here at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa in the near future. Please do not hesitate to contact me personally.     Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I too am a Diamond member, so I have lots of views into Hilton properties.   In short I would rate this one ok for the casual traveler, but not for the business traveler.      As noted in other reviews, there were only two people checking in large groups (water polo competition).  I had booked a king, but the staff had three different people argue with me that I had asked for a queen room (something I never do).   The first room I was sent to was on an incredibly busy and LOUD road (despite my profile indicating QUIET ROOM please).   I called down and asked for a different room.    I told the desk staff I would meet them at the new room.  The new room was down the same hall, on the same side of the hall.   Even nosier room, closer to a main intersection.     I went downstairs,
Manager Response: Dear sfae1111:   I am very sorry for the experience you described. I am researching your comments and would like to speak with you directly. None  of the issues you indicated in your review aligns with any standard operating procedure of the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa and I am investigating.    Summer is a high demand period for all hotels with increased family and special event travel and business travelers can find that frustrating at airports, in planes, in restaurants, and in hotels. Our business is based on exceeding guest service and while we welcome many guests to our hotel for many reasons, typical service  is professional and of high quality for all.    Once again, I apologize for your inconvenience and hope to speak to you personally at your earliest convenience.   Sincerely,   Rob A Gauthier General Manager

Summary: We were here for a family reunion, and were pleased with our stay.  The rooms were spacious, and the balcony view overlooking was very nice.  The carpets were a bit dark, but everything else was comfortable and clean.  The check in and check out was fast and easy.  The executive lounge and breakfast had a nice space for coming and going guests and a good selection of food to choose from.  I did not leave hungry.  I would stay at a Hilton again based on this trip, and am planning to look at the Hilton for our next family reunion in a different location.
Manager Response: Dear Trip Advisor Member:   Thank you for your review of the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. On behalf of the staff, your comments about our oversized, well appointed guest accommodations and the new Executive Concierge Lounge are very appreciated. We are continually striving to make significant changes to move the hotel services to the next level. We're so happy you noticed.   Once again, thank you and we look forward to your return in the future.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Good place to sleep during our Choir Trip!
Summary: My Golden Valley Choir group and I stayed at this hotel during our comp in Anaheim in March and I must say it was pretty fancy hotel considering the scenery inside. After a day of singing, we were pretty much exhausted and wanted to go to bed which we did. My roommates and I stayed on the 5th floor and the room was really nice, view of the airport and pool, beds were comfortable and it felt like we were living the good life. One thing that was weird was that when we came back from Disneyland around 11:00 P.M our door refused to open...some of the other students also couldn't get in there rooms as well...still to this day we don't know what was the deal was. Other wise it was a really great trip! Thanks for letting us stay here!
Manager Response: Dear Taylor B:   Thank you for taking the time to review the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. it was our pleasure to host your group during your recent stay in Southern California. Our staff is working hard to provide the level of service that guests find memorable.   I apologize for the issue with your keys and am investigating. Our hotel key system offers our guests security and can be compromised by lost keys requiring "re-keying" for security. Check-out dates can also affect key resets. Once again, I am sorry for any inconvenience.   We look forward to your return in the future.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Extremely crowded, and hotel staff not prepared.
Summary: During our stay at the Hilton, they also were hosting the national American Miss pageant and the hotel was simply not prepared.  It took over an hour to check in, the hallways were full of trash, and it took nearly 20 minutes to get up to the room due to the elevators being so crowded.  Their customer service was poor.  They definitely did not have enough staff to handle that amount of guests.  I am sure this would be an ok property if they were not so busy, but I would check to make sure they aren't hosting any events first before you book.  I will not be returning here.
Manager Response: Dear Stephanie Cochran 33:   Thank you for taking time to submit your review of the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. On behalf of the staff and myself, we apologize for your atypical experience here at the hotel during a period where we found ourselves hosting not just one, but several summer events that were highly popular in their attendance. In spite of our efforts to rise above the unusual demands placed on the hotel as a whole, we admit at times we were unable to insure that high level of service in each area we are well known for. The Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa is accurately known for its success in hosting highly professional events and for exceeding the expectation of our guests; when we fail, it is very disappointing to each of us.   Once again, my sincere apologies.    Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice building, but some serious problems
Summary: The baseboard had peeled away in the room The Buffet was terrible and seemed to have been made very far in advance and it ran out early in the evening. We were double billed for some of our dinner guests The fire alarm went off and the staff seemed to have no training as to what to do.
Manager Response: Dear Michael T:   I apologize that your experience here at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa did not meet expectation. There is no excuse for providing a poor experience to our guests; please be assured corrections have been made. The staff here at the Hilton are committed to be being the number one choice for Southern California travelers. When there is failure, we all have fallen short, so we all work harder to elevate the level of guest care.    Thank you for taking the time to provide your comments and I am truly sorry.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: My over all stay was great until my 7 year old daughter and I ate in the restaurant and I found a maggot inching across my fruit. It made me sick  to my stomach and I still don't like thinking about it. I think the Costa Mesa Hilton needs to focus on cleanliness in the kitchen.
Manager Response: Dear Deborah C:   On behalf of the staff and myself, I apologize for the unwelcome experience at your table. Unfortunately, in preparation of the meal, a worm got past our typically alert kitchen staff and that is unacceptable. The extremely high ratings the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa receives in terms of cleanliness, expert food preparation and storage, etc. by all concerning agencies failed us in this isolated instance and we are mortified. I assure you immediate corrections were made to prevent a future occurrence.    Once again, my apologies.   Sincerely,    Rob A. Gauthier

Summary: We had a great time in a very nice, clean hotel with everything we need ~ gym, pool, spa, restaurant, and gift shop!!  The staff was wonderful!!  The hotel is located in a great area with shopping and plenty of places to eat!!  We had a great stay and would go back again...
Manager Response: Dear Tana S:   Thank you for your great comments regarding your recent stay at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. Each of us here at the Hilton endeavor to provide our guests with a truly pleasing, comfortable experience and have made some significant upgrades throughout the hotel to ensure that. Along with our ideal location, with proximity to everything in the area- fantastic shopping, a wide range of entertainment, the major business centers in Costa Mesa, Newport, Irvine, And Santa Ana, we're also down the street to some of the most beautiful beaches in Southern California. Whether for business or leisure, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa is a perfect choice.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Service is not what it used to be
Summary: I frequent this hotel around 4- 6 six times a year for business travel and am a diamond member.  It had been several months since I visited the hotel which I absolutely loved, except for this time.  The hotel has been remodeled which is nice.  However, the other changes are ridiculous.  This highlights my experience: 1. Arrived early and was told to come back at 3pm since the hotel was booked solid which is not a problem.  I came back at 5 since I knew 3pm was not realistic.  There was a pageant going on and several baseball teams were staying there.  The hotel had 2 people at the front desk. REALLY 2 People.  The line was ridiculous and I waited over 30 minutes to get to the front of the line.  I was so pissed of because how can you have a sold out hotel for the next night and
Manager Response: Dear Mholi:   Thank you for being a Hilton Diamond member and for taking the time to provide your comments. I apologize for our failure to exceed your expectations as is our goal always. There are no excuses for providing less than excellent service to all our guests and I am sincerely disappointed we failed to do so. I hope you will give us another opportunity to show you what we are truly capable of as a preferred Hilton location in Southern California.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Home away from home for the business traveler
Summary: My business recently took me to the Costa Mesa/Santa Ana area of Orange County.  Normally when traveling to the Los Angeles area, I fly into LAX, but on this trip I decided to fly into John Wayne Airport in Orange county, due to its proximity to the locations I needed to visit.  My business associates in the area suggested that I stay at the Hilton Orange County so I booked a four-night stay. This Hilton property is quite large, though not a high-rise building.  It sprawls out over a large area but is only seven floors.  I prefer to stay away from towers where possible, as I dislike waiting for elevators.  This hotels has many (5 or 6) elevators, so the wait isn't long and the ride is also short.  It has a nice gym and pool on the second floor level, with the pool and spa being
Manager Response: Dear GregorioToronto:   On behalf of the staff of the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa, thank you for taking time to provide your comments about your recent stay. We strive to provide the services which our guests appreciate, whether their visit is for leisure or business. Our recently completed refresh of our guest accommodations, as well as other areas of the hotel, have been met with overwhelming positive critiques. Our guests seem to honestly enjoy what we're doing to continue to be the outstanding choice for hotel services and guest accommodations in Southern California!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: The Hilton Garden Inn in Costa Mesa, CA is a wonderful hotel.  Luxurious and high class - quiet and comfortable with all of the amenities of home.  If you have the opportunity to stay on the Executive level, definitely take advantage - so helpful to be able to grab a quick snack or a cold drink or just to have somewhere to hang out besides your hotel room.
Manager Response: Dear Karen G:   Thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa! On behalf of the entire staff, we are so happy to hear you enjoyed the Concierge Lounge with its high tech appointments, luxurious furnishings, and great food and beverage offerings. Our guests also love our 24 hour room service availability, the delicious California cuisine in the Bristol Palms restaurant and the full service lobby bar. And near our welcoming reception desk, the Starbucks kiosk is greatly enjoyed morning, noon, and night by guests.   Whether for business or for leisure, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa offers spacious accommodations and a long list of services. With its convenience to everything the area offers-shopping, beautiful beaches, John Wayne Orange County Airport, theatre, and the major centers in Costa Mesa, Newport Beach, Santa Ana, Tustin, Irvine, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa is Southern California's best choice for the discerning traveler!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I enjoyed my stay and would come back. Staff were helpful especially the shuttle drivers and the restaurant staff. Mall was a walking distance and lots of nice restaurants and shops. Friendly city -Costa Mesa
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor Member:   On behalf of the staff, we are very happy to hear you enjoyed your stay at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. It was our pleasure to be your host and we look forward to your return to enjoy more and more of what Southern California and the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa offers travelers, whether for business or leisure!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: My experience could not have been any better.  From check-in to check-out.  The front desk clerk was SO helpful.  I booked the room on Expedia and then realized I would miss out on my HHonors rewards, but the front desk clerk immediately asked me if I was an HHonors member and found me - the room rate was GREAT - the room was FANTASTIC (2 sinks!). I wish I could go back tomorrow!
Manager Response: Dear Paula P:   Thank you your comments; on behalf of all of us here at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa, it was a pleasure to be your host. We especially appreciate your remarks about our spacious, well appointed guest rooms. We're making special efforts to provide our guests with the best in amenities, services, and beautiful accommodations. Whether for business or for leisure, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa is the best choice in Southern California!     Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Fine hotel in a good location.  I'm not a Hilton fan.  Recently stayed at the Hilton in Tyson's Corner which is next to their corporate headquarters building.  While the facility there is about the same (though kept up much more nicely), the service and cleanliness was WAY better.  I arrived at the Costa Mesa location to step into an elevator that smelled badly (somebody got sick, perhaps?).  When arriving on my floor, there was an empty Starbucks cup and a candy wrapped in the elevator lobby.  That trash stayed there until mid-day the next day!  The room at the Costa Mesa was fine--clean but the faucet in the tub was pulling away from the wall.  Workout room was fine but HOT and humid--no air circulation.  The workout balls could have used a little air--they were pretty
Manager Response: Dear SWUWHIT:   Thank you for taking the time to provide your comments, though I was disappointed to hear we did not impress you as the best choice for service and accommodations in Costa Mesa. Allow me to personally apologize for your negative impression of the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.    On behalf of the staff, though we strive to exceed our guest's expectations of service, unfortunately in isolated situations we fall short. There is no excuse for the perception of the hotel being less than very clean and well maintained, as the hotel's reputation is known for. Your concerns are being addressed to insure prevention of any reoccurrence and once again, I sincerely apologize.     Regarding your comment about parking, like other metropolitan cities, in the Costa Mesa/Irvine/Newport areas, parking space is at a premium. Here at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa, charges for our self-parking facility are highly competitive as compared to area competitors; we are pleased to offer it's availability to our guests.      Once again, I am very sorry your impression in this incidence was negative, but hope you will return to allow us the opportunity to demonstrate our high standards of service and accommodations.    Best regards,   Rob   Rob Gauthier | General Manager

Summary Heading: Very good value for the price
Summary: This hotel was very clean, very comfortable, and had a nice amount of options for food inside and outside of the hotel. Many local retail shops and restaurants within easy walking distance, and a very convenient shuttle to the mall.
Manager Response: Dear Rachel F:   On behalf of the staff and myself, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. We appreciate your comments about our great location and transportation, with convenience to everything the area offers visitors to Southern California. Whether for business or pleasure, we're minutes from John Wayne Orange County Airport; the great shopping at South Coast Plaza Mall with over 250 boutiques and 30 dining establishments and nearby Fashion Island; plus a wide range of entertainment venues; the most beautiful beaches in Southern California  and close proximity to the major centers from Irvine to Costa Mesa/Newport to Santa Ana and Tustin.    Thank you also for noticing our efforts to provide well appointed accommodations and services guests appreciate and look forward to experiencing including our newly redone spacious guest rooms, the Bristol Palms restaurant and lounge, 24 hour room service, as well as the inviting outdoor pool & spa and our fully equipped exercise facilities.   Thank you once again for staying at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa and look forward to your return!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice full service Hilton near OC airport
Summary: Things to know:  rooms are really nice, bed very comfortable.  Exec lounge on concierge level serves a great breakfast, lots of choices.  Sbux in lobby, plus a nice gift shop with everything you need,  they nick you like 21 bucks to park, pretty standard.  Compared to the Westin just down the street this hotel a really great value.  Big, kind of old fashioned lobby, nothing worth noting.  Gym pretty nice.  Summary...clean, good rooms, great value.
Manager Response: Dear Murphysjsr:   Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. On behalf of the staff we are appreciative you noticed all the great additions and upgrades we've made and are continuing to make here at the Hilton. From our beautifully appointed, extra large guest rooms with balconies to the expansive breakfast buffet featuring delicious items like eggs cooked to order and Belgium waffles in the Bristol Palm restaurant, the Hilton strives to please our guests.    Our location is perfect for visitors to Southern California for business and for pleasure, with close proximity to all the area offers-shopping, entertainment, the major business centers with 5 miles, and the best beaches along the Newport coast.   Once again, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Was here for one night for a one day workshop, room is spacious and clean, internet was included because of conference rate, however, was charged parking though the organizer told me that it's included in the rate. Overall, pretty good for the location.
Manager Response: Dear Cakewalk2011:   On behalf of the staff, thank you for being our recent guest at the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. It's ashamed you were unable to stay longer and enjoy our close proximity to so much Southern California offers visitors. Within minutes of Orange County/John Wayne Airport, without being at the airport; just down the street from luxury shopping at South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island; convenience to all of the area's major business centers and entertainment; near the most beautiful beaches of Southern California.   We sincerely appreciate your acknowledgment of our new, spacious and beautifully appointed guest rooms.   Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa and come back soon.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I had one of the best salads and a great meal at a Banquet held at the hotel.  The room was very nice , big and full equiped.  Such an easy trip from the John Wayne air port.  Pick up was easy to find and delivery was timley and the return was on time.
Manager Response: Dear Robert H:   Thank you for acknowledging the key benefits of your recent stay at the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. On behalf of the staff, it was our pleasure to be your host. We are working hard to provide the highest quality in services and amenities; our guests' positive reviews keep us on track!    I hope your travels bring you back to the area and to the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa very soon, in the meanwhile, thank you once again.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier

Summary: Classic good Hilton experience. Great customer service, breakfast buffet wonderful, good workout facilities & nice executive Honors lounge. Paying for parking in a suburb is a bummer, the air conditioner was not working and average room amenities. All in all a satisfactory stay for business.
Manager Response: Dear IKE48:   We appreciate your critique and while you provided an overall satisfactory, it is unacceptable to us that you did not fully enjoy the great amenities and services of the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. It is concerning that you indicated your A/C didn't seem to work. While unfortunately these issues sometimes arise, our staff is diligent in providing quick and efficient solutions to any guest issue when we're informed. You did not indicate whether you reported the issue and/or our ability to quickly solve the problem before it caused inconvenience, but I sincerely apologize.   In regard to the parking fees, as with our key Four Diamond competitors in the area, we do charge a fee for parking, but I can assure you, less than any other hotel in Costa Mesa.   Thank you once again for choosing and recommending the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Hotel was beautiful, clean, and staff was very polite. We enjoyed the location being close to retail shopping, groceries and fine dining. The pool area was quaint, with the hot tub secluded away from the pool and plenty of tables to enjoy an early breakfast or snacks later in the day. Thoroughly, a delightful stay!
Manager Response: Dear Pauly H:   Thank  you so much for your commentary about the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. I could not have said it better- well located and in close proximity to everything! Great pool and spa, providing an oasis in the city! And just to add, our spacious guest rooms are newly updated;  we offer 24 hour room service, a great restaurant and lounge, the Bristol Palms and lastly, look forward to your return in the future!   Best wishes,    Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Agree with other reviews, this hotel has average rooms and facilities, but charges ridiculous rates to selff park ($21/night) and for internet ($14/day) and no breakfast included. Plenty of better options on the area.
Manager Response: Dear rshwietzer:   Thank you for taking the time to complete a Trip Advisor critique. We are sorry you found our full service hotel with upscale amenities including spacious, newly redone guest accommodations, 24-hour room service and popular Bristol Palms Restaurant & Lounge, as well as fitness center, beautiful pool, and spa not to your liking.    Like all other Four Diamond hotels in the area, our convenient parking area is at a fee, but less than our competitors as is the in-room internet service (complimentary in the lobby areas). Unlike limited service motels, upscale hotels in key metro areas often charge upwards to $40-$50 per day for parking and over $20 per 24 hour period for internet access. Here at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa we've done our best to minimize those additional charges, while offering the amenities and services our guests enjoy and always positively comment on.    As one of the highest rated Hilton Hotels, we continue to add, refine, and improve and will certainly take your comments to heart.   Best wishes,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Paying for self parking and WiFi in a business hotel?!?
Summary: Not impressed with this hotel. Standard hotel room which is fine, but absurd $21/day to SELF park? And add fees for WIFi on top of that? There are plenty of better options in the Costa Mesa area. Go elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear MunichExpat:   We apologize for any inconvenience the parking fees created. As with the majority of the competitors at our Four Diamond level, parking is at a premium, but rest assured, we charge less than any other hotel in the area (as with in-room internet service) and continue to consider each service and amenity for its benefit to the guest. We are constantly improving the hotel as a whole to continue to be one of the highest rated Hilton Hotels and will certainly pass on your comments to senior management.    Best wishes,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Stayed here 3 nights while traveling for business. Rooms were clean & comfortable. Quiet hotel convenient to John Wayne Airport. Staff was very friendly & helpful. Loved that they had a Starbucks on site. Nice hotel for the price - I will stay here again when I'm in town.
Manager Response: Dear Kateland622:  It was our pleasure being your host; thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa during your recent business trip to Southern California. On behalf of the staff, we're so happy to hear you enjoyed our new, spacious guest rooms with features travelers truly enjoy-large,comfortable beds, flat screen TVs, and balconies that provide a front row seat to beautiful Southern California sunsets. Amenities like Starbucks conveniently located in our lobby; 24 hour room service; our restaurant and lounge, the Bristol Palms with its impressive breakfast buffet offerings as well as diverse menus that appeal to everyone, from delicious steak and brick oven pizza to Californian Cuisine rounds out a great experience.   Our proximity to everything the area offers from a diversity of shopping at South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island, to the major business centers of Southern California, also Orange County/John Wayne Airport, and some of the most beautiful beaches California offers down the street, provides the best location geographically for travelers.  Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. We look forward to your return soon.  Sincerely,  Rob A. Gauthier general Manager

Summary: Other than being charged for self parking...& they tried to charge us for (2) days when we had a vehicle for only one, everything about our stay was perfect. We were delivering a car to our grandson, driving over and flying home. If other guests are lucky, they will be served dinner (our party of 12) by Andrea and while waiting for the next airport shuttle, asked for input on our stay & be welcomed to return sometime by your Guest Service Manager - Stacey Pierce-Girssom...a consumate professional.
Manager Response: Dear Renny R:    Thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. It was a pleasure to have you as our guest. Your positive comments are appreciated, especially noting Stacey's hospitality, one of our many valued associates. On behalf of the entire staff, we strive to serve each and every guest, providing the services that are meaningful, in an ideal location for Southern California travelers.   We look forward to your return.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: The "Essence of California" Event was wonderful!
Summary: I attended the recent hotel event to get a look at the newly updated Executive Lounge and new guest rooms.  The hotel looks amazing!  I had a wonderful time at the event as well!  My company uses this hotel exclusively and we are very happy with the service and our folks really enjoy their stays!
Manager Response: Dear Pamela R:   Thank you for your review of the Hilton Orange County/ Costa Mesa; especially noting our brand new Executive Lounge and the beautiful new guest rooms and suites! Guests are truly enjoying the spaciousness of our rooms, along with the new appointments, and balconies that provide visitors to Southern California an unique view of those terrific Pacific sunsets.    On behalf of the staff, it's our commitment to service that drives all of our efforts and we are so happy you noticed! We look forward to having you back at your earliest convenience.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier, GM

Summary: great rooms and great service, the rooms were lovely and the size is perfect for business trips with many options nearby for entertainment. The breakfast offering is wonderful with numerous choices of fruit and delicacies.  i loved my stay at the Hilton Costa Mesa.
Manager Response: Dear Stuart B:   It was our pleasure to have you as our recent guest. Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay; we appreciate that you noticed our new, spacious guest rooms and the extensive breakfast served in the Bristol Palms Restaurant, also serving lunch and dinner. We also offer 24 hour room service and Starbucks!   The Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa offers a great location with close proximity to everything from the local airport, Orange County/John Wayne Airport, the business centers of Orange County, the  extensive shopping everyone enjoys at South Coast Plaza and Fashion island, and the beautiful beaches of Southern California, just down the street.    Thank you again for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. We look forward to your return to Southern California.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier, GM

Summary: The hotel is nice. I stayed on the 7th floor or executive floor. It was nice the bathrooms are above average for a business hotel. It is not a vacation type hotel. The internet speed is above average. Room service is good. TV remote is a pain and the pillows are not very good. Overall though it was good for what I needed
Manager Response: Dear JeffP:   Thank you for your positive comments. On behalf of the staff, we are happy to hear you enjoyed some of the amenities and features of the hotel during your recent stay. The Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa has the unique advantage of being ideally located in close proximity to so much Orange County offers guests, whether traveling into the area for business or leisure. Near all the major business centers, as well as within minutes of the best shopping and entertainment this area offers, including South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island. Also, just down the street from some of the prettiest beaches in Southern California and only 25 minutes from Disneyland's front gates, the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa truly offers something for everyone including being near Orange County/John Wayne Airport without being stuck at the airport.    We hope to see you back again very soon and thank you once again!   Sincerely,    Rob A. Gauthier GM

Summary Heading: Helpful staff, nice room/public spaces, good rate
Summary: I don't know if my rate here was lower than "usual," but it was very reasonable.  My room was very nice and the public spaces are also welcoming, comfortable, and attractive.  Although the group I was with had to eat dinner pretty late one night (10 p.m.), the bar staff handled it well and did a great job.  Front desk folks were very professional and helpful, too.  All in all, it was a good stay and I'd definitely come here again if/when I'm looking for a business hotel near the O.C. Airport.
Manager Response: Dear FlyGuy47:   Your comments are greatly appreciated, thank you! On behalf of the staff, it is our commitment to provide the best service, as well the most well appointed guest rooms and public spaces in Orange County. As we continue to add to our features to even better exceed the needs  and wants of our guests, whether visiting the area for business purposes or leisure enjoyment, it is our goal to address what is truly valued by our guests.    Once again, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. We look forward to your return!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier GM

Summary: I stayed at this hotel recently for three days as part of a large conference. I must say that everything was wonderful!  First of all, the staff was so professional and friendly, very accommodating, helpful, and happy!   The rooms are big and nicely furnished, including a refrigerator.  This hotel has great meeting rooms and facilities for large groups and the wait staff was efficient and friendly even when serving several hundred people. The food was good and plentiful. There is a Starbucks in the lobby for a quick breakfast or a full restaurant. South Coast Plaza is walking distance for both dining and shopping. I found this hotel so comfortable that I would recommend that my group come back again next year.
Manager Response: Dear JoanS:   Thank you for your great comments about the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. We continue to upgrade and evaluate how we can exceed the expectations of our guests. We have some great new changes on the horizon for the hotel, in terms of added features and services, and can't wait for you to experience them very soon.    Once again, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier GM

Summary: I stayed here recently for a meeting and had a pleasant enough stay. The hotel is near lots of great Costa Mesa shopping and the freeway. I wouldn't call it a destination hotel. They have a Starbucks in the lobby that closes by noon. There are many meetings rooms of different sizes that make it an appropriate choice for conferences. The hotel room itself was OK, no mini-bar, though. You're pretty much stranded without a car here. The food was good, not great but I only ate the catering -- didn't try the restaurant.
Manager Response: Dear HuntressCA:   Thank you for taking the time to complete a TripAdvisor Report. As a popular conference hotel with over 50,000 sq. feet of flexible space including everything from large, medium, as well as  comfortable boardrooms rooms we offer something for everyone's event. The Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa's offers an ideal location near not only Orange County/ John Wayne Airport (with free transportation), but close proximity to some of the best Southern California beaches, convenience to all the major corporate business centers the area offers, and more shopping, entertainment and dining to please the most discerning guest with transportation provided.   Our newly redone spacious guestrooms with unique features such as balconies that provide great views of Southern California sunsets, the beautiful outdoor pool, fitness center, and Bristol Palms restaurant and Lounge, plus 24 hour room service rounds out why we're so highly rated by Hilton guests worldwide. We hope to see you back at the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa real soon. Thank you again for choosing us for your Southern California visit.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier

Summary: My daughter and I stayed at the Orange Country Hilton during a recent conference and would rate this hotel as one of the best in the world.  Room and service were impeccable.  Because we are vegans we would have liked more menu choices but apart from that we couldn't have been happier and thoroughly recommend the hotel.  Would definitely stay there again if in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Falksnviolet:   On behalf of the staff, thank you for your great comments about the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa! We are working hard to elevate our services, and the entire hotel to exceed the expectations of our guests.    I appreciate your viewpoint that more vegan options should be offered to our guests, whether in the Bristol Palms Restaurant, as part of our lounge food service, or in our 24 hour room service presentation. I assure you, we will be considering adding more vegetarian/vegan choices as we build upon our newest menu creation to ensure our food service encompasses the desires of all of our guests.   Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. It was our pleasure to be your host; we hope to see you back very soon!     Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Last week I visited this hotel for at least the fourth time in a ten year span, so I guess a review is past due.  I am a meeting planner and was hosting a group which used up nearly 200 of the rooms in this hotel for a weekend.  I found it remarkable that not one of the guests at our conference approached me with any complaints about the hotel.  That does not mean there were NO complaints...just none that were brought to my attention.  The hotel underwent a large renovation in the past 12 months and while I don't know all the details, I believe the carpet is new and very likely the other softgoods in the rooms.  The most noticeable bragging point for the hotel, in my opinion is the quality of their food.  I ate at Bristol Palms (lobby restaurant and bar) several times and found
Manager Response: Dear Group_Hotel_Pro:   Thank you choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. It was a sincere pleasure to have you and your group with us. Your kind comments are greatly appreciated, especially pointing out some of the new changes we've made. We have many more surprises in store to elevate the hotel, as well as service here at the Hilton, and can't wait to show them to you.   Our location does offer a lot of convenience to travelers visiting to this area, whether for business or pleasure-close proximity to  Orange County/John Wayne Airport, beautiful Southern California beaches, the major Orange County business centers, and just across the way, the enormous South Coast Plaza Mall with the best retail and speciality stores in the country, as well as fine dining and casual restaurants. And of course, we offer guest transportation to the entire area including restaurants, theatres, and other entertainment venues.    Thank you once again for allowing us to be your host.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: The rooms are very comfy but - I'm not happy at this hotel. Service is negligible. They claim to have a restaurant and there is one - but not open. Instead, it is hit or miss service in the bar. Previously undisclosed $21 per night parking charge....as if anyone walks in OC. It would be more honest to include parking in the room charge so that you could make an informed choice. Although they claim to have free wi-fi, you can't have it unless you are an Honors Rewards member. You can't even get to the Honor's rewards site to sign up unless you are already a rewards member. Finally, even though I let the desk know I was unhappy on my prior stay with service/internet, I was given a "wonderful" room next to the elevator with a view of the filthy skylights. Way to turn around
Manager Response: Dear Karen C:   I am very sorry your experience here at the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa did not meet your expectations. It is our goal to exceed the guest's expectations, not fall short; we are disappointed we failed.   The hotel does offer a great restaurant, the Bristol Palms with an extensive breakfast buffet and diverse menu, as well as many lunch offerings. During dinner hours, we extend our guests a popular menu in the adjacent lounge, because of numerous requests to do so. It is has been a strong success, but obviously you would have preferred the restaurant setting and we apologize. We also offer 24 hour room service as well as the Starbucks in our lobby.   In terms of parking, like most hotels in major populated areas, we charge a fee for parking but I assure you it is below many of our competitors.    Once again, I apologize for your less than perfect experience here at the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa, but sincerely hope you will give us another try. We have many new changes coming this year and look forward to presenting them to our future guests.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: We had such a great experience with Betty as our server.  She was attentive to our needs.  We  visit this Hilton twice a year and we are always greeted with a smile from Betty.  The rooms were clean and the beds are very very comfortable.  We plan on continuing our stay at this Hilton.
Manager Response: Dear Michele W.:   On behalf of the staff of our Palms Bistro restaurant and the entire hotel, thank you for kind comments. It is our pleasure to continue to be your first choice in Costa Mesa. Our convenience to a diversity of entertainment and business venues that are offered in the area including the airport, great shopping, all the major corporate centers of Southern California, as well as some of the prettiest beaches California is known for, are just a few of the reasons guests choose the Hilton Orange County-Costa Mesa as their preferred hotel.   We look forward to your return very soon and thank you once again!   Sincerely,   Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent overall, lobby cleanliness needs work.
Summary: Best Bathroom Award would be well deserved, and room was very clean and well-maintained.  Upper-level cleaning in the lobby will hopefully be addressed in the very near future, as will some maintenance issues (painting) in the decorative areas of the pool.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler34104: Thank you for your helpful critique and comments. On behalf of the staff, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. We have been making numerous improvements to the overall hotel and some of your comments about specific areas are being upgraded, improved right now! Please come back and enjoy for your next trip to Orange County.   Once again, it was our pleasure to be your host.   Sincerely,   Rob Gauthier

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, convenient to freeways and john wayne
Summary: As expected with a hilton... clean rooms and nice ambience.  Hotel also had a nice bar and restaurant but we opted for nearby restaurant.  Parking was expensive of course.  We went with another couple and had adjoining rooms which was nice as well.  There are two hiltons 5 miles apart so be careful to get the right one...they're both about the same though...
Manager Response: Dear Brandon E:   Thank you for your great comments, on behalf of the staff, we're very appreciative. We continue to work hard to exceed our guests expectations and are continuing to make significant upgrades in all areas. As you enjoyed, our central location to so much offered in Southern California is a great asset, from the business centers of Orange County, to the best shopping in a five radius, convenience to the airport without being at the airport, and the beautiful beaches of Newport.   Once again, it was our pleasure to be your host.   Sincerely,   Rob Gauthier

Summary: Across the freeway from South Coast Plaza, had medium expectations for this hotel but was very pleasantly surprised.  Plenty of parking, lobby very enjoyable and comfortable, and the rooms were very nicely appointed.  I stopped short of a 5 all around as there was occasional airplane noise but that stops at 11:00 so I was more than happy with my stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for kind remarks about the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. I will pass on your comments to our staff who continues to strive for excellence in each area. We look forward to your quick return and once again, thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa!   Sincerely,   Rob Gauthier

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, and very accommodating.
Summary: This hotel is everything you expect from a Hilton. A great location (at least for me), very friendly and knowledgeable staff. The room was modern and up to date. Valet parking was extremely efficient and friendly offering a better route to John Wayne Airport than I was using.
Manager Response: Dear RichardK:   It was our pleasure hosting your recent stay in Southern California. Thank you for your comments and for noting our staff's commitment to providing the highest level of guest service. As you mentioned, the Hilton Costa Mesa Orange County offers a terrific location, with close proximity to so much the area offers-shopping, business centers throughout Costa Mesa, Irvine, Santa Ana, and Newport as well as convenience to John Wayne Airport while not being at the airport.   Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Costa Mesa Orange County.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at a number of hotels in the Costa Mesa/Newport Beach area over the years, but this is where I'll stay from now on.  Recently spent one night here and everything was perfect.  The staff is friendly and professional and the recently renovated 7th floor room was beautiful.  Most surprisingly, the food (dinner and breakfast) was excellent -- far exceeded our expectations, as often times hotel food is mediocre or worse.  This hotel is ideally located for shopping, access to Orange County offices and John Wayne airport.  Thank you to all of the hotel staff for such an enjoyable experience.
Manager Response: Dear RightOnThe Corner:   As a seasoned traveler, your comments are especially appreciated. On behalf of the staff, thank you for noticing how hard we're working to provide not only well appointed accommodations with upscale amenities, but service that exceeds our guests' expectation. The Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County is conveniently  located near Orange County/John Wayne Airport, but not at the airport. We're walking distance of several entertainment venues, the wonderful shopping choices at South Coast Plaza, and within minutes of the major business centers in Costa Mesa, Irvine, and Santa Ana and down the street from some of the best beaches in Southern California.    Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County. We look forward to having you back soon!   Best regards,   Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for one night on a business trip. The price was very inviting for advance booking. I had to check in later than normal but that was not a problem... The hotel restaurant was still available for me to catch a bite before heading to my room. I actually had to remind my self that I was in the hotel and not in an elegant nite club in the city. The wait staff was very accommodating. The Valet employees were also accomodating. My room was very clean and well stocked with supplies. The bed was absolutely a dream to sleep in. I didn't have the greatest view because of the location of the room but since my stay was only for one night, I didn't mind not having a view. I was offered complimentary Wi-Fi service which I was very happy about.
Manager Response: Dear AVR41:    Thank you for your kind comments about the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County. On behalf of our staff, it was a pleasure being your host. The Hilton offers terrific convenience to major business centers throughout Orange County, as well as a multitude of shopping, entertainment venues, and the sandy beaches of Southern California.   The Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County is completing its refresh and our new rooms, as well as other public areas, great pool and fully equipped health club are the reasons we're #1 with so many travelers. Also, 24 hour in-room dining, the Bristol Palms restaurant and lounge with the real brick pizza bar, and convenient lobby Starbucks provide our guests the options they enjoy. Once again, thank you for choosing us and we look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,    Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay close to John Wayne Airport
Summary: Once or twice a year I stay at the Hilton in Costa Mesa and did so on March 13, 2013.  Even though I checked in a little after midnight, the staff was friendly and prompt.  My room was ready and the bar was still open.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The in-room coffee was very good, but I could have opted for the Starbucks in the lobby.  Check out was swift and painless.  Parking prices are very high, but that seems to be the new normal.  The front drive is under construction so the entrance is not quite as convenient as usual.  The hotel bar is an ‚Äúin‚Äù place, and the hotel restaurant is very good.  Overall a great stay very close to John Wayne Airport and central Orange County.  Be sure to check the web site for an AAA or military discount.
Manager Response: Dear Crewdog13:   Thank you for the great comments about the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County, especially the amenities offered throughout the hotel and the convenient location to so much in the area - Orange County/John Wayne Airport, a multitude of shopping options, entertainment, and the major business hubs in Orange County.   Our spacious upscale guest rooms have big comfortable beds, a 40 inch flat screen TV with a wide choice of viewing selections, gourmet coffee and teas and the Cuisinart coffee maker, and many rooms have balconies.   Besides 24 hour in-room dining, the lobby lounge is welcoming after a busy day and fresh, California menu selections, including our brick oven pizza, is far above the typical hotel fare in our dining room.   For travelers requiring parking, like many hotels located in high demand areas across the country we charge for parking. We have made every effort to minimize our fees, charging well below our competition.   Thank you once again for choosing the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County. We look forward to your return soon!   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Typical Hilton but under renovations and there are rooms to avoid
Summary: I've stayed here a few times and hoped the construction would be over. No such luck and from my perspective I had a hard time seeing the upgrade from the work Be warned that any room that is next to the elevators will be noisy 24/7. The room is separated from the elevator lobby and you would think noise was not a problem but by some strange quirk the room X69 where X is your floor number is filled with sounds of the elevator machinery Sadly when I notified the desk of the problem at check out the response was disappointing...checking my profile and telling me I needed to request a room away from elevators! Is there anyone who would want to listen to that noise all night!? Gym was nice and well appointed and equipped with a a lot of machines (not much in the way of
Manager Response: Dear DrNic1:   I am very sorry that your recent stay at the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County did not meet your expectations and can sympathize with your frustration. It is totally unacceptable that one of our guests was unable to enjoy a quiet, relaxing experience in their guest room. I can honestly state that I haven't received any negative comments about elevator noise in this hotel so I am surprised, but will be immediately investigating.   On behalf of the staff, thank you for choosing the Hilton; I hope you will allow us another opportunity to improve your opinion and truly enjoy the hotel so many guests choose as their #1 in Orange County.  Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: It's a nice hotel - a bit older, off the beaten path - but near John Wayne airport and South Coast Plaza.  It's not a luxury Hilton, but a good solid business choice.  You won't go wrong here.  It's a decent hotel if you want a value full service stay.
Manager Response: Dear TravelManSouth:   Thank you for choosing the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. We're the #1 choice for many travelers, whether driving in or flying into nearby Orange County/John Wayne Airport, seeking the ideal location in the Costa Mesa/Irvine/Santa Ana/Newport area with close proximity to everything offered-major business centers, extensive shopping, entertainment, and beaches. We've completed a refresh that includes redoing our spacious guest rooms with upscale furnishings and appointments from floor to ceiling and our balconies still offer the best view of the beautiful Southern California sunsets!    24 hour in-room dining service, our enjoyable atrium lobby lounge, restaurant with real brick oven pizza kitchen, and a nearby Starbucks Barista standing ready provides hotel guests with many options. Our outdoor pool is inviting and a fully equipped exercise center offers guests every option for a good work-out while traveling.    On behalf of the staff, we appreciate being your host and hope you'll come back soon to see all our exciting new changes.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I made a reservation on a Wednesday to attend a wedding at the hotel on a Saturday. When I arrived on Saturday, they had no record of the reservation, no rooms available, and basically told me and my date that we were simply out of luck. The on duty manager claimed that it was my responsibility to provide a confirmation number (which the hotel's reservation receptionist did not give to me), and because I didn't have one, there was nothing they could do. The reservation person did remember to take my credit card number however. They did not have any rooms available for contingencies, and refused to call any other local hotels to help given the timing and circumstances. We had arrived two hours before the event needing to change into our wedding attire, and by the time the hotel
Manager Response: Dear David L:   I am truly sorry there was confusion regarding your reservation to stay in town for this wedding. The process of taking a room reservation at the Hilton Costa Mesa/ Orange County involves reconfirming the details of the reservation 3 separate times including the guest receiving an email or text confirmation with all details. "Lost reservations" would be a very difficult result to create in the national Hilton Reservation System, where reservations are taken. I am doing further research into this matter.   By your review I understand you are angry. The imposition you were placed in must have been very frustrating. Unfortunately, the hotel was completely occupied during the period you are speaking about and we were unable to accomodate nonreserved guests. In regard to our staff not assisting by calling nearby hotels, I am investigating as it is not our policy to be unhelpful. Our reception staff are highly regarded for their service; this isolated incident requires immediate follow-up so there are no future issues.   Once again, I am apologetic about your frustration and am sorry your impression was not based on staying in our hotel as I am certain your review would have been entirely different.   Best wishes,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: PROS: Affordable yet almost pricey if it were $10 more. One of the best "affordable" hotels in the U.S. , Clean, Great Service, Beautiful Dual Sink Bathroom. Big Room. King Suite w/ Full Size L Shape Couch, Desk & Chair. Refrigerator. Nice view from 7th Floor for Diamond Members. Incredible Breakfast Buffet at the hotels restaurant.   Would definitely stay again.    The only con was the cost of parking $21 ouch.
Manager Response: Dear Warrior44:  Thank you for your great review. On behalf of the staff of the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County it was our pleasure to be your host. Our central location to so much Southern California offers from the major business centers, shopping, theatres, and beaches makes the Hilton a popular choice for travelers whether driving in or flying into nearby Orange County/John Wayne Airport. I understand your concern about parking fees, but I can assure you that we are below the area competition in parking fees. As in many major US markets, parking is at a premium in the Costa Mesa/Santa Ana/Newport/Irvine areas for business and pleasure. We try to make it reasonable and convenient.  As we continue to complete upgrades to our hotel, in all areas, I hope you will come back and be our guest in the near future. Thank you again for choosing the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County.  Sincerely,  Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I was very satisfied with the Hotel. Cleanliness of the room and customer service. Bed was very comofortable. Continental breakfast was so good. It is close by Disneyland, John Wayne airport and South Coast plaza shopping center.
Manager Response: Dear Yasin:    Thank you for taking the time to critique the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. The Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa offers travelers convenience to a wide range of entertainment venues, shopping, beaches, restaurant options and even the nearby John Wayne/Orange County Airport including various transportation options for those without cars.   Our hotel has recently completed an exciting, as well as extensive update including within our extra large guest rooms (with balconies that offer a great view of Southern California sunrises and sunsets), adding even more beautiful and upscale appointments from floor to ceiling! The Bristol Palms restaurant offers a large selection of fresh and delicious breakfast options including Eggs Benedict and also a buffet that leaves our guests wanting for nothing-French pastries, Scones, hot and cold cereals, French Toast, Bagels, Smoked Salmon, Bacon, Sausage, Eggs, Potatoes, juices, and on and on. And, unique to many hotels, we offer 24 hour room service and a Brick Pizza Oven bar right in the Lobby! Once again, thank you for your comments. We look forward to your return to the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.  Sincerely,  Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, but hotel is lacking service
Summary: i travel quite a bit for work, and stay at Hilton branded hotels exclusively; however, I must say this property has been the least liked experience.     Realizing the hotel is going through renovations , I would expect some things to be out of the ordinary; however, my dissatisfaction are areas that should not be affected.     First, the breakfast buffet is very disappointing.   The hot food all appeared to be quite old on the serving dishes, the potatoes has the consistency as if they were microwaved.   The eggs were completely overcooked.   The only item worth eating was the bacon.    On the 2nd morning, I learned to request my eggs cooked to order which is not advertised; however, be warned, it literally took 15 minutes for my 2 eggs to arrive to the table, that is after
Manager Response: Dear Jeffro1975:   As I responded in my direct correspondence with you, I am truly sorry for your experience. As a seasoned traveler and loyal Hilton guest, your expectations were not met and we are disappointed.    The Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County has an excellent reputation for service that goes beyond expectation, as well high ratings in housekeeping as well as food and beverage. Thank you for informing us of the isolated issues you experienced last weekend. The areas which fell short are being addressed, corrected, and changed to insure they meet guests' wants and needs.   Thank you again for providing your critique and input.   Sincerely,    Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Ugh, I stayed here once before, because it was our Corporate Preferred Hotel in the area, and wasn't impressed.  Had to come back, and thought I would give this property one more try.    STILL not impressed.....VERY DATED, VERY 1970's decor, and a horrible, nauseating smell in my room. I'm not sure if it's a cleaning solution or what, but it is awful.  Thankfully I have a huge balcony, so I can get fresh air and that helps.  The view, however, is of the top of the parking deck and faces the airport (noisy).    The hotel is in the midst of renovation, but it appears pretty minimal and cosmetic. The bones of this hotel are dated and very 1970's and no cosmetic changes are going to alter that.  Bad carpets and lighting fixtures....ugh.  Room itself is renovated and fine...big flat
Manager Response: Dear Stoulson:   Thank you for your critique of the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County. We are sorry our architecture did not meet your expectations. The Hilton is a contemporary building located in the heart of Orange County with close proximity to everything the area offers-Orange County/John Wayne Airport, South Coast Plaza Mall, beaches, numerous entertainment venues and much more, but it's what on the inside that really matters. Our recently completed refresh of our extra large guest rooms have been a big hit with guests and we see by your positive review, you enjoyed them as well with our great big, comfortable beds, flat screen TVs, and upscale appointments. The decor is California Contemporary with warm browns and rust colors and modern art. Our balconies provide an added feature giving our guests views of the great Southern California sunsets!   I apologize that you felt the parking fee was in question. Unfortunately, like so many hotels across the country located in high demand locations, parking is at a premium, though we have strived to minimize the charge to our guests as compared to our competition who charge more. For guests without vehicles, or who do not wish to drive, we do offer complimentary transportation to and from the airport, as well the area shopping, theatres, etc.   Unfortunately, even as a leader in hotel popularity in the Costa Mesa/Newport/Irvine area and with our commitment  and success to always exceed our guests' expectation, we can't be everything to everyone, but thank you for giving us an opportunity.    Best wishes,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this location for three nights in February.  I got bed bug bites around my ankles and all over my legs.  I researched the CDC website and their images confirmed the bites are bed bug bites.  I emailed photos of the bites to Hilton to alert them so they can clean it up.  All I got wer two form letters that did not address anything.  I wouldn't be surprised if there was no actual follow up.  STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK. You have been warned.
Manager Response: Dear Food-Happy-AA:  I am so sorry you had the experience of having "bites", but like all hotels with excellent reputations such as the Hilton Costa Mesa/Orange County, we are regularly evaluated to insure we have no pests and have had no reports of any kind of pests from our guests, so I feel you may have our hotel confused with another.    What you are describing are not indicative of bed bug bites, a problem hotels across the world are unfortunately periodically experiencing with the outlawing of pesticides that previously kept those issues under control. International guests will unintentionally transfer these pests in their luggage and airline travelers will pick them up even on airplanes and in movie theatres. Because bed bugs hide in mattresses and come out at night, bites are usually seen on the trunk part of the body (back, chest, shoulders), not ankles. Possibly you came in contact with an animal with fleas and/or at beach which sandflies will bite.    Nevertheless, I am sorry our response was not more to your satisfaction. When we are informed of any issue with a guests we have an immediate response that you are not describing in your critique and have not deviated from this procedure with my knowledge. Since I have no record of any complaint at this hotel, I can only assume once again that you have this hotel confused with another.  Sincerely,  Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Great staff, reasonable location for shopping at South Coast Plaza.
Summary: The Hilton Costa Mesa is a good solid 4 star property within walking distance of South Coast Plaza. (a free shuttle bus also departs each 2 hours).  The easy walk to the plaza is around 10 mins.  I have stayed at this hotel on 15+ occasions and what I can say is as such:     Not all rooms are the same - there are a whole heap of rooms on the lower floors (2 and 3) that have tiny windows of less than 2 foot in height, positioned at almost ceiling height - and that is it!  These rooms are dark, damp, sometimes smell musty and are a horror to stay in.  At the ends of each floor are rooms with floor to ceiling windows - lots of natural light, bright and roomy - but no balcony.  There are also a small number of rooms overlooking the central atrium in this format with little / no
Manager Response: Dear LondonBusinessA:  On behalf of the staff, our sincere thanks for your detailed and constructive comments regarding the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. We know our associates are our greatest asset and your recognition of their hard work and commitment to guest service is greatly appreciated.   Though our valued guests love the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa as is, we continue to make many improvements and add enhancements throughout the hotel for everyone's enjoyment. And, as you mentioned, our location, so near so much - shopping, beaches, business centers throughout Costa Mesa, Newport Beach, Santa Ana, and Irvine offers almost everything Southern California travelers desire, with numerous transportation options and even walking distance in many cases.           Thank you again for being a returning guest of the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa and for letting the world in on the best             choice in Costa Mesa, California.           Sincerely,           Rob Gauthier         General Manager

Summary Heading: Great staff, good location, friendly atmosphere
Summary: We stayed for 3 days with a very large group of water polo players that ranged in age from 8-18. The hotel lobby area is not huge but seemed to easily accommodate the large numbers.
