The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly. Some of the rooms overlook the atrium and I could imagine that they might get pretty noisy.  The breakfast buffet was good and our only complaint was the price of the drinks at the bar.  There are several fast food places within walking distance and a 7-11 across the street. The South Coast Plaza shopping mall and cinema complex is nearby.   The hotel is well situated near the 55 freeway, a couple minutes south of I-5, and near the airport. It was a quick 20 minute drive to Disneyland and the beaches.
Manager Response: Dear Si405:   Thank you for taking the time to critique the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. We greatly enjoyed having all our guests last weekend-water polo players, business guests, many social groups and wedding parties and especially you. The Hilton offer much to so many and its our goal to be even more!   As you mentioned, the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa offers travelers convenience to a wide range of entertainment venues, shopping, beaches, restaurant options and even the nearby John Wayne/Orange County Airport.   Our hotel has recently completed an exciting, as well as extensive update including within our extra large guest rooms (with balconies that offer a great view of Southern California sunrises and sunsets), adding even more beautiful and upscale appointments from floor to ceiling than they had before! The Bristol Palms restaurant offers a large selection of fresh and delicious breakfast options including Eggs Benedict and also a buffet that leaves our guests wanting for nothing-French pastries, Scones, hot and cold cereals, French Toast, Bagels, Smoked Salmon, Bacon, Sausage, Eggs, Potatoes, juices, and on and on. And, unique to many hotels, we offer 24 hour room service and a Brick Pizza Oven bar right in the Lobby!   Once again, thank you for your comments and please come back again to the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,    Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary: One night stay in early February 2013. Hotel was clean and staff was helpful and efficient. The fitness center had lots of equipment and allof it was in working order. Also, ate in the restaurant for breakfast - expensive but lots of choices
Manager Response: Dear Dave S20002001:   Thank you for taking the time to critique the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.  I apologize that you felt the parking fee was in question. Unfortunately, like so many hotels across the country located in high demand locations, parking is at a premium, though we have strived to minimize the charge to our guests as compared to our competition. And, unique to many hotels, we offer 24 hour room service and a Brick Pizza Oven bar right in the Lobby! Once again, thank you for your comments and please come back again to the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.   Sincerely,   Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Spent 4 days recently at this hotel and truly enjoyed it. The staff is very attentive from check-in to check-out. Were especially helpful in directing me to nearby sites, shopping, and entertainment. I found the hotel to be very competitive in pricing but actually better quality than the nearby Marriott I've stayed in previously and nicer in many ways than the Westin I've also stayed in. I had the great breakfast buffet several mornings as well as the Eggs Benedict on the menu. Two nights I ordered room service which was really fast and delicious. They have a nice bar too. My room was beautifully appointed, wonderfully comfortable beds, and huge compared to so many hotels these days with a balcony. I really loved the upscale Cuisiart Coffee Maker and mini-frig. I could see the
Manager Response: Dear LindaL:   Thank you for your many nice comments about the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. On behalf of the staff, we appreciate your enjoyment of the many amenities and guest room appointments we offer and continue to look for ways to elevate our services for our guests. Your satisfaction is meaningful to each of us. We honestly try to do more because our guests deserve more!    Once again, thank you. It will be our pleasure to welcome you back soon!   Sincerely,   Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Am a diamond member so get to compare lots of Hilton family properties.  Quick Review.  Get picked up at the airport in a minivan that comes to SNA twice an hour.  Nice driver though.  Lobby impressive but rooms seem very old and worn.  Seems possibly construction on 7th floor (exec level) so perhaps that was reason I was not offered an upgrade.  No notification of construction though  Executive lounge is awful.   Is very small and you can't even see the one TV from most of the seats.    Only a continental breakfast.  But nice server  Next time will try the Hilton closer to the airport.  Hilton Irvine I think
Manager Response: Dear AndyF:   Thank you for taking the time to critique the Hilton Orange County/Costa Mesa. On behalf of myself and the staff, please accept my apologies for your disappointment in your recent stay. We are committed to being the the first choice to travelers coming into the Costa Mesa/Newport/Santa Ana/Irvine area, and are truly disappointed when we fail to meet our guests expectations.   The Hilton  Orange County/Costa Mesa offers travelers convenience to a wide range of reasons including the nearby John Wayne/Orange County Airport, near but not at the airport which many travelers prefer, especially with our proximity to so many business and entertainment sites. We offer extensive transportation options to and from not only the airport, but nearby shopping at South Coast Plaza, various entertainment venues, as well as area business centers.    Our hotel has recently completed an exciting, as well as extensive update including in our extra large guest rooms with balconies, adding even more beautiful and upscale appointments from floor to ceiling than they had before! Our restaurant offers a large selection of breakfast options including Eggs Benedict and also a buffet that leaves our guests wanting for nothing-French pastries, Scones, hot and cold cereals, French Toast, Bagels, Smoked Salmon, Bacon, Sausage, Eggs, Potatoes, juices, and on and on. And, unique to many hotels, we offer 24 hour room service!   Once again, I am sorry your stay failed to meet your expectations, but sincerely hope you will give us another opportunity in the future.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Overall, not bad, could have been better
Summary: My wife and I stayed here at the end of January for a week. It was business related but we extended it for a small vacation. We made reservations well in advance and when we arrived around 8pm we were told they were sold out of the rooms that were reserved for my group. The only room they had was a handicap room. I was told that the room still had a king size bed and the only difference was that the shower had metal bars in it. Well, when we got into our room we found out the real deal. The shower is wide open, no bath tub nada. It was like an open military shower. My wife was NOT happy. I went downstairs to see if we could get a different room and was told to come back the next day around late morning and they may have a room. The room also had a huge door to the bathroom as to
Manager Response: Dear Mort 439:   Thank you for taking the time to provide a very inclusive report on your stay. Each comment was appreciated and I will be taking further action on several items you mentioned, (and have already made some changes).    Allow to me to address the issue of your guest room request not satisfied at check-in. Firstly, I apologize for the necessity of your party having to move the next day to a guest room you preferred. I understand you were inconvenienced and am sorry. This is a rarity as our hotel works very hard to not only meet, but exceed the needs of our guests' requests before, during, and even after their stay. Unfortunately, demands can sometimes fluctuate creating a temporary need to utilize "last sale" guest rooms such as ADA guest rooms. They are identical to standard guest room except for the items you mentioned, i.e. wider doorways, shower accessibility. Nevertheless, when we fail to meet the expectation of our guests we are disappointed.   We believe our guests deserve the highest level of service and amenities we are able to offer and with that goal, we continue to enhance our hotel-from guest rooms amenities, to food and beverage options, as well as services that truly address the wants and needs of our guests. Procedures and policies are also constantly reviewed for improvement. Thank you for assisting us in your constructive critique and for noting the positives including location, the many services we extend, etc.   Once again, thank you for taking the time to give us feedback and please come back soon to see the many enhancements currently being completely for the enjoyment of our guests!   Sincerely,    Rob Gauthier General Manager

Summary Heading: Orange County Gem - Orange Juice Pricey!
Summary: A friend rented out the starwood suite on the top floor for the night before and the night of her wedding. The suite was stunning and spacious, and offered lots of storage for the groomsmen, the bridesmaid, and the bride and groom. The photographers, make-up & hair crew, and family members also visited before the ceremony to get everyone ready, and it did not feel stuffy at all. We ordered room service to toast the bride, but room service charged us $8/ glass of orange juice. Um. Hell no! Luckily, the manager understood and offered a more cost-effective plan, but it still dampened the already highly charged mood of the bridal party. Just a quick tip on parking: Valet charges about $8 more per night than self park, but sometimes the $8 is worth it if you're coming back to the
Manager Response: Dear HelloKittyLover0717:   On behalf of the staff, your positive comments of one of our beautiful suites is appreciated. I hope everyone had a great time at the wedding!   The Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa offers Southern California travelers the best choice in location, services, and hotel accommodations in the entire area. Offering everything from proximity to business and entertainment venues to nearby beaches and the Orange County/John Wayne Airport, with many transportation options available to and from the hotel.   Thank you for choosing the Hilton. We look forward to having you back soon.   Sincerely,   Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel at the end of January while in Southern California on business. Overall the hotel has a good look and feel to it but there were just a ton of little things that made me not as impressed.  First of all as soon as I walked into my room I was hit with a weird hotel smell that made me super nauseous. The room was a decent size but I felt like I had to turn on 4 lights just to be able to see. One main light switch near the door that activates a major light would be very helpful. There was also a ton of LOUD construction going on above me and to the side of me. I know that in order to renovate rooms these things need to be done but of course when I am working on my laptop inside my room those renovations don't really affect me and only disturb me.  The room did
Manager Response: Dear MattC:   Thank you for taking the time to provide your comments about your January stay. Our guests enjoy the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa's great location, central to so much in the Costa Mesa, Irvine, Santa Ana, and Newport areas including everything from the area's major business centers to the South Coast Plaza shopping complex, a multitude of entertainment venues, and even nearby beaches.    While we are happy to have impressed you with some things, we are sorry that we were unable to meet all of your expectations. In regards to any noise inconvenience created by the exciting enhancements we are completing here at the hotel, my sincerest apologies. We have made every effort to cushion our guests from any direct contact with the newest changes occurring here at the Hilton, and are disappointed we failed that day.   Once again, thank you for letting us know what we did great;wanting to always be the best, we appreciate your constructive comments which help us improve.   Sincerely,    Rob A. Gauthier General Manager

Summary: Last minute change in business took me from North of LA down toward Huntington Beach and I booked this Hilton on the airplane with little research...I was happy to find a great property.  The property is well kept, room was comfortable and clean, and all the staff was friendly. I only stayed here for one night so can't provide a very detailed review but pretty much everything was up to standards which seems to be harder and harder to find. As a Diamond Member, it was nice to find this property.  Two things that kept it from a 5 Star Rating was:  They don't offer much in the way of complimentary breakfast. I've stayed at both kinds of Hilton's, compare Hilton in Naples, FL that offers complimentary cooked to order breakfast at Don Shula's restaurant for Diamond Members to this
Manager Response: Dear CCTVTrainer,   Thank you for taking the time provide us a review of Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. On behalf of the staff, it was our great pleasure to be your host during your short trip to Costa Mesa. We strive to exceed the expectations of our guests and I'm happy to see that your found our staffs friendly and we were able to meet most of your expectations.   We deeply value your feedback, we will be sharing your feedbacks regarding the Complimentary Breakfast with our Food and Beverage team. Some great news to share is that we are indeed in the process of updating our Executive Lounge, so next time you visit, you will see these wonderful improvements.    Warm Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary: Stayed here Friday night in room 562.  The room was nice, view was good, everything was clean, and I was enjoying my stay....until the slight noise started early morning (it wasn't distinct, but in my sleep I could hear that it sounded like construction, but maybe was other guests being loud).  THEN 9am came and they were literally pounding right above my bed.  It was SO loud.  I could understand if work needed to be done, but they should really be checking to make sure that none of their hotel guests would be effected.  If I wanted to wake up early, I could've just stayed home.  This was supposed to be a nice relaxing morning for my birthday, and instead I was woken up and couldn't go back to sleep.  Self parking was an additional $21, and although it is a good location near a
Manager Response: Dear Sugarsht,   Thank you very much for your review of your past stay at Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. While I'm glad to hear that like the room, location and the cleanliness, we are very sorry that noise was an issue during your stay. New perspectives about our hotel and our guestroom appearance help us make improvements to our guest experience on an ongoing basis. If you travel again to Costa Mesa, we hope we have the opportunity to show you our improvements.   Warm Regards,   Doris Leung  Director of Front Office

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and close to the beach
Summary: Needed a reasonably priced hotel for the night as we were going to the beach the next day. AAA rate $107. Staff very nice and professional. Clean and comfortable. Very reasonable. Just a hop on the freeway and we were at the beach in 15 minutes. I feel we got a really good rate as the hotel seemed crowded with a convention. There is a little snack bar in lobby with Starbucks and fresh pasties and fruit. We got something to go in the morning. Faster than sitting in a restaurant. I would definitely stay again since beach so expensive.
Manager Response: Dear Debunnie,   Thank you for choosing Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. We're happy to hear that our service and our great amenities made your stay more comfortable. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with all of us. We look forward to seeing you again in the near future!  Warm Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary: Stayed just one night at this beautiful Hilton and would definitely go back. The beds were sooo amazingly comfy. The room was spacious and clean. My only complaint is as a Hilton chain I expected the complimentary breakfast that they are so famous for. I believe it was only available for "executive" levels and higher room rates. Good location, close to freeways and Santa Ana Observatory which is a great little venue for concerts. Friendly staff, valet for $28 or self park @ an additional cost of $21. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Socalgirl41,   Thank you for taking the time to write us a review on Trip Advisor. We're glad to hear that you were able to enjoy your stay and found our famous Hilton Bed comfortable. Yes, there is a charge for breakfast, but this is no ordinary continental breakfast you'll find at other hotels. It is a full hot breakfast buffet with items made with the finest ingredients. If you are not a member already, we strongly urge you to sign up for our HHonors loyalty program. It's free to join and you can earn points towards complimentary room nights and member-exclusive privileges at all of the Hilton Family properties.   At Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa, we definitely have plenty to offer and we hope you choose to stay with us again.   Warm Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary Heading: Airport hotel but shuttle service is inadequate
Summary: If you are picking this for airport convenience then I would suggest not. The shuttle is a passenger mini van that holds 7 people. That's a big problem if you are on an early flight as it only starts running at 5:30, runs every 30 mins and you might find there is not enough space for you to fit.  It's a typical Hilton otherwise. They are doing renovations so should be upgraded soon Gym is adequate with 6 treadmills (1 was out of order) and has a nice view overlooking the pool Morning papers limited to USA Today. If you want the WSJ they are looking to charge you.... This was a first for me
Manager Response: Dear DrNic1,   Thank you for your insight on your recent experience at Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. We're sorry that our airport shuttle service didn't meet your expectations. We have shared your comments with our Transportation team so that they can review the shuttle schedules for our guests, especially in the morning time when many of our guests depart early.   We appreciate your feedback and will keep your comments in mind while we work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will stay with us soon and tell us what you think about our improvements.   Warm Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary: In my recent stay to this hotel, I was expecting warm weather in southern california, but it was very cold, around 40F at night. Many rooms had problems with heating, and the dining room was very cold. This hotel is very clean and well maintained. Staff is nice and helpfull, but it was hard to get the heat going.
Manager Response: Dear Daniel,   Thank you for sharing your experience with us on Trip Advisor. While we're happy to hear that you found our staffs very helpful and accommodating, we apologize for the malfunctioning heating system in your guest room and the main dining room. We'll be sure to address the issues with our maintenance team and hope you'll consider giving us a second change if you return to the area.   Best Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel with pleasant staff, lovely pool and very comfortable beds.  Just be aware that they tack on a $5
Summary: Very comfortable hotel with pleasant staff who let us check in early.  That was a big plus.  There's a nice large swimming pool and two spas as well as a small but sufficient gym.  Just be aware that they tack on $5 for room service food.  This was a shock to me.  A bowl of oatmeal ended up costing me $12!
Manager Response: Jennifer W.  Executive level for our Executive Travelers with views of the city and the planes taking off or landing at John Wayne Airport. Definitely a great location with South Coast Plaza just walking distance ,although we offer complimentary shuttle service to and from the South Coast Plaza to make holiday shopping a breeze.   Regards,  Yolanda H. Guest Service Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for  a few nights after Christmas and again in early January.  First of all, the hotel is a few blocks away from South Coast Plaza, one of the premiere shopping malls in the U.S.  The hotel offers a free shuttle to and from the mall throughout the day. There are many, many restaurants nearby, including Morton's, Capital Grill and Season's.  The hotel itself is lovely, rooms are comfortable and well furnished.  There is a bar/restaurant in the lobby as well as a coffee bar.The hotel's location is great -- close to the 405 and 55.  It's a quick drive to Irvine.  (I recommend Houston's restaurant there).  John Wayne Airport is also near.  This worked out well for us as my husband was close to his business location, and I was near shopping, etc.
Manager Response: Dear JamesBondLosAngeles,   So happy hear you had a great stay and were able to enjoy not only the restaurant inside the hotel but the restaurants close to the hotel. So many choices for all your tastes and enjoyment.  Capital Grill, Charlie Palmer, Season 52,  are some of the delicious and awesome restaurant choices at the South Coast Plaza. Then close to the plaza and Segerstrom Center of the Art is Scott's Seafood, Morton's for a memorable dining experience each and every night.  Best regards,  Yolanda H. Guest Service Manager

Summary: Stayed for a 4 day business seminar. As far as hotel accommodations go it was as expected. Clean rooms decent accommodations. Food however left a lot to be desired as did the wait staff. They were curt and down right rude.
Manager Response: Dear Loomen8,  As we consistently train and retrain our associates to exceed our guests expectations we are sad to read you had a negative experience. Our retraining will focus on our wait staff at this time and we thank you for your feedback. We are thankful to read your accommodations were comfortable and your event went well. We hope next time you will be able to enjoy the beaches in the area. I would suggest Laguna Beach if you love art and volleyball or Huntington Beach for on the beach fire pits with the family . Life is wonderful at the beach!!  Regards, Yolanda H. Guest Service Manager

Summary: My husband has stayed here a number of times but this was my first time here. This is a nice business hotel, well located in Costa Mesa. It is very close to John Wayne Airport and also the South Coast Mall. The rooms have been freshened up recently, and are very large and nicely decorated. Ours had a balcony over looking the pool and hot tub. Each room has a sink out side of the bathroom area. The hotel was very clean with nice facilities. There is covered parking on site and a shuttle. You are a short drive down to Newport Beach and the stunning pacific coast drive (if you are able take a drive to Capistrano or Laguna Beach). We look forward to another stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staid here on business for one night, and it was good. The experience you'd expect from a business class hotel.  Check-in was friendly and efficient, the room is spacious, comfortable bed, clean bathroom. I didn't try the food or any of the amenities like pool or fitness room, I really was there only to sleep. And that i did comfortably.  Location was perfect for me, as I had business to do next day at the South Coast Plaza Mall, which is 2 minutes down the road.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hilton quality and services you would expect except front desk
Summary: Interior decor: Standard Hilton sets - excellent Exterior appearance: Tall building near South Coast Plaza and Interstate 405 Outside view from the room I stayed at: West side of Costa Mesa - mostly residential - average Services: Understaffed front desk - took over 10 minutes waiting to checkin. Otherwise, breakfast service was very good as the staffs paid attention to details. Bed: Soft - King size - slept well Room size: Adequate - approximately 35 square meters Price value: With all other major chain brands competing for Orange County Airport vicinity as well as for South Coast Plaza and Irvine tech centers, price paid was very reasonable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice hotel. Loved the fact that there were two sinks in the bathroom, one in the shower unit and one outside of it. That made travel with a roommate even easier. No need to wait your turn to brush your teeth! Beds were super comfy and felt luxurious. Our group had dinner in the lounge and it was really tasty and fresh. Nice convenient location for business travel. Would definitely recommend this hotel over others in the area we've been in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here 28-30 and was amazing. Stayed in seventh floor executive level and was amazing. Executive lounge was closed so gave us free breakfast along with free Internet and parking!!! Food at breakfast was okay not bad. Not a variety of options no waffles or hash browns or pancakes. Had eggs and toast. The man who was there ( his name was Nicholas I think ) he was really nice and remembered us every day. Nice lady at checkout but could not see her name. Glass elevator. Would come back. And why does everyone say it's bad when it was actually good? The room was bait bigger in size in general.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't Depend on The Shuttle Service!
Summary: I recently stayed here on business in the fall. Although the hotel was nice and comfortable my experience with the shuttle service was awful! I waited for 40 minutes for the shuttle when I arrived and ended up walking to the hotel which was OK as it was very close. I wouldn't have bothered to call for the shuttle had I realized the hotel was so close.  My worst and most memorable experience was when I went to South Coast Plaza. I was told to be at a location at 8 pm which was an hour before the mall closed. I waited and waited. The concierge called twice for me and was told the driver was on his way. Over an hour and a half later he finally arrived. Not impressed!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Interesting!!!! A fight broke out next door!
Summary: The room was great, comfy beds & mice bathroom etc.   BUT there was a huge domestic disturbance in the room next door! A huge fight broke out next door! A black male was banging our neighbours door, swearing & yelling. He the proceeded to smash a table & throw a fire extinguisher against the door! There was glass shattered everywhere! & there were dents on their door! We asked for security guard but the night doorman came! He were told cops will be on the scene! They Never showed up!!!!  They need night security! We didn't feel safe! Nthis happened from 3.30 am till 5.00pm We still don't know the full story & didn't feel safe!!! & had to switch rooms twice!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for sharing your review of your recent experience at our hotel. We are very glad you enjoyed our guest rooms but sincerely apologize if you felt at any time unsafe during your stay. The disturbance during your stay is not typical of our hotel and we can guarantee that we will do a better job of handling these situations should they ever happen again. The safety of our guests is our top priority and we regret that you felt yours was compromised in any way. Please reach out to us if there is anything further we can do to resolve this with you. Thank you again for your feedback.   Sincerely,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary Heading: Standard in most respects, but great workout room!
Summary: My flight arrived very late so a bumpy check-in.  A dark scary walk through the parking garage to the front desk but once there I was upgraded to the Executive Floor. Wonderful views, which I appreciated.  It also means access to the Executive Lounge, which unfortunately has some kinks to work out.  Due to my late check in (11PM) I was told that the Exec Lounge was the only place to find any sort of food.  I probably would have settled for the unhygenically served granola had there been a bowl available.  Sadly, a carton of milk had to do. Tried again the next morning: the Starbucks coffee machine is not user-friendly and fond of spraying customers.  The room also lacked a trash bin so used napkins and yogurt cups were just sitting on the counter.   The Exec Level room itself
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for your candid review of our hotel. While I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our fitness center, I am sorry to know that you were not completely satisfied with your experience throughout your stay with us. We will be sharing your experience with our team and assure you that we are looking into how to eliminate these types of situations. We hope you can give us another chance to show you what a great hotel and staff we have here.  We look forward to welcoming you back in February!   Warm Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary: I was here for a conference, so I stayed by default.  This hotel is just old and boring.  Everyone was nice, polite and professional, and the age of the place did not equate to bad service.  The room was very dated, except for the bed and television.  The bathroom, the decor, the shower and toilet need to be condemned.  Everything was clean.  The rooms and lobbies are just ugly and tired.  But keep in mind the rate.  Sure, the Westin blows it away, but the Westin is double the price.  Because of the nice service and the fact everything was clean, I would consider it again, but only if the price is right.  The place is nothing to be scared of, but it is not Orange County Cool.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  First of all, thank you for your review of your past stay at our hotel. We always appreciate hearing from our guests - including when comments help identify ways we can improve. I was glad to read from your review that you were treated well by our staff. Our main priority is for all our guests to have a welcoming and comfortable stay with us.   I do however understand that you found our hotel to be dated. I can assure you that your feedback is incredibly important to us. In fact, we are looking at different options to upgrade and renovate our property.   Again, I thank you for your review and sincerely hope you give us another opportunity to stay with us next time you‚Äôre in town.   Warm Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary: Very dated, needs a facelift. Bartender unfriendly. Drinks as expensive as at fine dining restaurants but stingy pour. Shower had a used bar of soap in it. The only good thing was the bellhop will give a lift to local venues if not too busy. We got a ride to a restaurant then picked up after a show at the Segerstrom Center. Still, not a worthy Hilton. Wonder how they keep their franchise.
Manager Response: Dear Dave,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review on Trip Advisor. We seem to have left you with much to be desired of our property and for that we're extremely sorry. We would like you to know that your input is being taken seriously and will be shared with our team so that we can continue to improve our guest experience. Some great news to share is that we are indeed in the process of updating our guest rooms so that you will have a different experience when you return in the future.   Thank you again for your feedback. Happy Holidays to you and yours!   Warm Regards,   Doris Leung Director of Front Office

Summary: Check in very easy staff were all great not to busy just a nice pace the rooms are very big with room to store luggage I stayed in Anaheim last time in the states but would stay here again easy drive to San Deigo and around town the restaurant was nice for dinner and the bar was great at the end of a long day staff were great on a let down the breakfast was very average executive lounge was also nice but needing work and not open on weekends is not good .. Over all worth a try if your in LA   Hilton worth a try  Front office staff magic all 3 ladies great work the type you want when you get somewhere after a long flight
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pros: a couple blocks from the big big mall.  Right off the 405.   Comfy beds. Large room- with desk, reading chair, vanity, flat screen.  FREE WI-FI!   Free USA Today.    Cons:  long walk to the room.  Coffee in the little coffee pot isn't that great.   Will stay here again!  Rooms are so large!
Manager Response: none

Very nice staff especially Ian! right across from airport and down the street from IHOP. Cons: Overpriced breakfast buffet--charged my hubby full price for 5 and 7 year olds. Never gave us enough towels in our room, we had to keep calling for extra towels. Ran out of towels at the pool too! street signage is confusing.

The problem tho is that it is the same time as the orange county fair so alternative lodging is hard to get and very expensive.

The hotel is another example of Hilton class and comfort. Rooms are spacious, clean and accomading to the family & business traveler. No need to leave the facility with the excellent room service, interior resturant and the compliant of Star Bucks.

Rooms were nice sized and bath products of high quality! Lighting Perfect in our room - maybe Tpersall didn't have a window - ours was huge! Had clean bathroom although ours had a few ants. Complete with ironing board and iron. Blowdryer worked well. Their conference facility was large and the coffee and tea service was always refreshed! Ice water with lemon excellent touch also!

They are in the midst of completely redecorating the guest rooms with new furniture, carpet, drapes, beds, and bedding.  The old furniture is comfortable and inviting with a leather lounger that I wish I could take home.  As with any hotel in Costa Mesa, the parking fee hurts a tad at $21/night for self park.  Beyond that, I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.  BTW, the food in the lobby restaurant was fresh and delicious.

Summary: We stayed in orange county for 5 nights and it was an alright experience. The rooms were good enough, i would say a 3.5, though there really wasnt enough lighting. The service was only okay. We had called down twice for towels and they never showed up at all. The staff at the bristol brew was really great( this is the coffee shop on site) they were so friendly every morning. Would I stay there again? Yes. If the price was right.
Manager Response: Dear Tpearsall,   I appreciate your review of your recent experience at our hotel. I am glad to hear you were pleased with our guest rooms during your weeks stay with us. Here we were extremely well looked after every evening by Hung who somehow manages to remember everbody's drinks as they walk in the lounge, keep the food fresh and topped up, and keep all the tables tidy.  All at this at the same time as keeping a cheery smile on his face.  What a star! The rest of the employees were excellent including Katie on front desk who was very helpful and Chris and Dean at the bar.  The food was excellent.  The hotel is also in a great position for visting Orange County, Huntington and Newport Beach, very close to I405.  Nothing to grumble about.  We will return....

The executive lounge in open for a continental breakfast daily at 6am - but it really was not stocked with food until 6:20 am. The lounge is not open for cocktails or snacks in the afternoon. It wouldn't have been bad enough to change my decision to stay here again. Right next to John Wayne airport! Their meeting rooms are gorgeous! I was very pleased with my stay here!

Summary: My stay here was perfectly fine but unremarkable.  The hotel has a very dated feel in the lobby, corridor, and rooms (although they have attempted to update the rooms a bit with new linens and flat screen TVs).  Room was a bit dark as well.  However, it was clean, and the bed was comfortable.  Staff was perfectly pleasant.  I ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant, as it was included in my rate.  French toast was tasty enough, but not anything special.    The fitness center was pretty nice.  It had a good amount of windows, which caused the fitness center to feel light and airy.  There was a good selection of equipment -- 5 or 6 treadmills, multiple elliptical trainers, a couple of bikes, and weight equipment.  All seemed in good repair and of the same quality found in my gym
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location close to bars and restaurants as well as south coast plaza. Nice priceline deal so great value. Look for street parking auf you want to avoid $20 parking charge.  Overall a solid 4star pleasant experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: In general a nice hotel with rooms reflective of usual quality you can expect at a Hilton.  One issue was the Executive lounge -- at breakfast the place was a complete mess. Every table was full of used plates, cups and debris. In the room, for the in-room coffee maker they had only provided one packet of regular coffee and and only one sweetener. As a very regular business traveler, things like this are a nuisance and not worth the effort to have them bring something like an extra coffee packet and sweetener to the room (and then there is the obligation to tip...).  I spoke to the manager and she offered nothing but an apology -- a better call would have been to be more accommodating.  Next time I'll find a different hotel in the area as there are plenty from which to choose.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The worst Hilton I have ever stayed in
Summary: If you have allergies find another Hilton.  The web-site indicates it is Dog Friendly and my allergies flared up after one night.    In addition to that, the firealarms went off.  The people using the PA clearly didn't receive training, you could even hear conversations going on back and fourth over the PA.  Doesnt make for a good night's sleep.  I didn't get a newspaper in the morning and as I walked down the hallway I was shocked to see it was littered with room service trays with half eaten food from the night before - not from that morning but the night before.  I counted 12 of them before I lost count or interest.  I am a Hilton Frequent Guest and I regret staying at this Hilton.  Stay at the doubletree or Embassy suites close by - you will get a lot more and pay a lot less.
Manager Response: Dear LAGuy90019,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our property.   We are a pet friendly hotel but have a very detailed cleaning program for all pet rooms.  We take pride in providing the very best service to our guests so your personal experiences are detrimental to our growth. We would like to apologize for the issues that you encountered with the firealarm and our response team. We have shared this information with our Property Operations and Security team so that we can look into the matter and resolve it immediately.   I also wanted to apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your stay in regards to room service trays and lack of a newspaper which we deliver to ever room five days a week. This is not indicative of the level of service that we pride ourselves on and we will take every measure to improve on these areas.   Again, we sincerely appreciate you taking the time to review our property and look forward to having you visit again so we can rectify this experience and create new positive memories!  Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: This was only a 5 day break from work to travel with my partner,whose trip was cut short and I was left to fend for myself. Check in was painless.  Unfortunately we were given a room without a balcony.  A quick call to front desk and we were advised hat the were not any balcony rooms available until the next day.  By lunch time we moved to another room on the same floor.  No fuss at all! Then we were advised us one of us would have to leave early (days).  We found hiss out at about 11pm.  Down we went to the front desk to see if we could organize a rate for me, as the company was originally paying for the room.  We were given a very generous corporate rate, no problems and I could keep the same room.  As I have a late flight ms Hoa was ver patient while we worked out whether to
Manager Response: Dear Den and Jim, Thank you so very much for taking the time to review our hotel on this site.  It makes us very happy to hear that you had a wonderful experience at our hotel as we strive to serve all our guests to the best of our abilities. I'm so glad to hear that we were able to move you to a balcony room and that it worked out for you! Also, thank you for sharing your thoughts about the pool area. We'll definitely work on this. And of course we'll make sure Hoa, Eric and Mike knows how much you appreciated his service during your stay! They are outstanding team members!   We once again thank you for your input and look forward to seeing you again. Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: The best hotel in Costa Mesa,
Summary: This Hotel is pet friendly, we had our dog with us, we love this hotel and so does he. The overall service and the in room dining service were absolutely great. This hotel is very close to south coast plaza shopping mall. We would definitely stay at this hotel in our next vacation.
Manager Response: Dear Roza_Berni, Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel on this site.  We are delighted to hear that you had an outstanding experience with us. We work very hard to make all our guests experiences the best possible and it's so gratifying to read reviews like yours that validates the team's hard work!   We certainly hope to you see again really soon. Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed here before a flight. We checked in late and they were very quick. One small issue - the room we were given was occupied. Luckily we only walked in on someone's unmade bed and leftovers. The clerk was visibly upset about his error. He upgraded our room and gave us free breakfast.    The room was spacious and clean. Nice size bathroom. My only complaint is with Hilton's choice of showerheads.  While the water is plentiful, it's low flow. It makes it impossible to rinse long hair.  The bed was kind of soft but I prefer a firm bed so that's just me.    The breakfast buffet was decent enough. Good selection of fresh fruit.  I wouldn't have eaten there I it wasn't free.  Parking is not free but that seems to be the norm now.
Manager Response: Dear SWFAN, Thank you so very much for sharing your hotel experience on this site.  We take everything our guests say very seriously and communicate all of your feedback to the corresponding departments when necessary. That said, we have shared your review with our team and will be implementing ways of avoiding some of the issues you encountered, specifically the occupied room mix up. We do get many complements about our large shower heads but  your comments are noted. We are glad you enjoyed the free breakfast and the rest of their stay with us. Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but difficulties obtaining simple things
Summary: I stayed here for a business trip, and stayed three nights.  I like the hotel as a whole; the rooms were nice, the lobby is nice, and the pool area is nice.  I did not like the fact that I am a gold member and could not get bonus points at this hotel instead of the free breakfast.  I requested the points instead of the breakfast (which is easy to do at any other Hilton I've stayed at), and was told they are not able to accommodate that.  So, I had three free breakfast coupons instead, and for a person that doesn't really eat breakfast, this wasn't very much of a bonus.  In addition, when trying to use one of the breakfast coupons, I chose enough items so that it exceeded the coupon amount.  So I paid the additional charge, but was told I could not have a receipt for the portion
Manager Response: Dear Affable_Dane, Thank you for taking time to share your thoughts and opinions on this website.  We are always looking for ways to improve our service levels and we wouldn‚Äôt have that opportunity without your feedback. Thank you for giving us that opportunity. I also wanted to apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your stay in regards to your Hhonors bonus points this is a training issue and we will correct immediately the same with the Starbucks challenge. This is not indicative of the level of service that we pride ourselves on and we will take every measure to improve on these areas.   Thank you again for your comments and we look to welcoming you back to the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa.  Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed here over Independence Day weekend.  I was very unsatisfied with the customer service I received from the moment I pulled into the hotel!  The valet staff was rude.  I was very unpleasantly surprised when I discovered that the valet parking was $28 per day!  Even more so when I relealized that the self-parking was $21.  The young lady working at the front desk was rude also. If I hadn't prepaid for my room, I would have left then.  We were booked into a king sized bed room, which wouldn't be bad if it were just myself and my husband; however, with our 3 children...it was a disaster!  When I asked her to please change us to a double room I was told that bed selection ends at three........?????  How could that be when check-in is at three?  A roll away bed would have
Manager Response: Dear VonJon82, Thank you for taking time to share your thoughts and opinions on this website.  We are always looking for ways to improve our service levels and we wouldn‚Äôt have that opportunity without your feedback. Thank you for giving us that opportunity. I also wanted to apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your stay in regards to the valet staff and room type. This is not indicative of the level of service that we pride ourselves on and we will take every measure to improve on these areas.   Thank you again for your comments and we look to welcoming you back to the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: First class service in a lovely hotel.
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Costa Mesa.  Large, inviting lobby.  Easy quick check in.  The entire staff was extremely friendly throughout our stay, always greeting with a friendly "hello".  Rooms are nice, large . clean and nicely appointed.  Suites have very large bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs. Bellman pointed out all the amenities for us upon entering our room.  Nice linens and comfortable beds topped off a lovely stay. Rooms were nice and quiet and we never heard any noise outside of our room  or through the walls and the property was at 100% occupancy.  And what more could you ask for than to wake up, take a quick elevator ride to the lobby and be greeted by the friendly baristas at Starbucks!  Full bar and restaurant conveniantly in the lobby.  Easy freeway
Manager Response: Dear Abbiesabdog, Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel on this site.  We are delighted to hear that you had an outstanding experience with us! Because you stayed a few days, you were definitely able to take in most of our offerings and from the sounds of it, you were happy every time! We work very hard to make all our guests experiences the best possible and it's so gratifying to read reviews like yours that validates the team's hard work!   We certainly hope to you see again really soon and once again create lasting memories for you and yours Kind Regards, Brian Keys Assisatnt General Manager

Summary: We were looking for a couples get away for a week. We encountered the same difficulties with deposit holds, $20 paking a day, $40 internet charge a day, breakfast at $20 a day...incredible charges. The pictures are misleading, the pool is beautiful in the picture but the one pool services the 400 guess, add 20 screaming kids and with no adult hours, I didn't get to even dip my toe in.   The rooms are clean and average. We spoke with Ashely within the second day and she didn't seem suprised at any of the concerns, more like she has heard them before. She said "Liz" was going to call us about the release of deposit, she never did, glad I didn't wait in the room all day for that phone call. We asked for a Suite (they have spa tubs in them, figured it would be nice since the pool
Manager Response: Dear Bardtracy, Thank you for taking time to share your thoughts and opinions on this website.  We are always looking for ways to improve our service levels and we wouldn‚Äôt have that opportunity without your feedback. Thank you for giving us that opportunity. I also wanted to apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your stay in regards to the deposit holds, the busy pool and team member response.  This is not indicative of the level of service that we pride ourselves on and we will take every measure to improve on these areas. In regards to the parking charges our prices are in line with all local hotels and our internt charge is $13.95 for 24 hours but we are now offering frr internet to all Silver,Gold and Diamond Hilton Honor members.   Thank you again for your comments and we look to welcoming you back to the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa. Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: I love the Hilton Costa Mesa.  Parking is adequate, but a bit challenging if you have to park on the upper floors.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  I would like to have a full service restaurant in the evening, but I stay there weekly because of the location, the access to the 405, and the comfort.  All in all, a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Biz Traveler 48180, We are delighted here at the Hilton Orange that you enjoyed your time with us. We just hired our new Executive Chef Jeff Vosburgh from the Beverly Hilton and he like you wants to open the restaurant for dinner service instead of serving the full menu in our lobby bar so we will make that happen in the coming months. We look forward to welcoming you back soon. Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: I would highly recommend this Hilton for the following reasons:  1) location, its close to the 405 and 55 which are two major highways in SoCal and South Coast Plaza which is a major shopping mall in that area; 2)  the rooms are large and very comfortable, 3) very clean;  4) starbucks in the hotel itself; and finally 5) the pool is very comfortable! Overall I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Mipesq, We wanted to reach out and thank you for your review of our property.  We are delighted that you got to enjoy all that our area has to offer and hope to welcome you back again soon.  Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: The location to John Wayne - SNA is great. However if you pass the driveway like I did it is a pain to get back to where you need to be. The hotel is your average Hilton, slightly over priced for what you are getting. Also pay for parking here. There are a few other hotels that have a pretty good location near by where you can park for free and get a better value. Free high speed for diamond members, otherwise I think it is $15 per day.
Manager Response: Dear Pbekas, We at the Hilton Orange County wanted to reach out and thank you for your kind review. We understand that the highway system around is complicated but are lucky to be close but not too close to the off ramp. In regards to parking we are constantly checking to see that our prices are competitive but your feedback is noted and appreciated We now offer free high speed internet to all Silver, Gold and Diamond members as a form of gratitude to their loyalty. Thank you, Brian Keys  Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband & I stayed at the Hilton Costa Mesa for one night enroute to La Jolla.  We have stayed here many times and once again found a well run, clean and tidy hotel with excellent staff.  It is located close to Newport Beach, good shopping and is close (but not too close)  to the freeway.
Manager Response: Dear Possum Pal, We are delighted to see a review from Australia. We are lucky to have a number of Australian guest stay with us and we have Australian sports channels available in our Bar and Pizza Bar area. We are glad you got to taste some of the things that make this part of Southern California such a joy to live in and we hope to be able to welcome you back in the future. Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: I choose to remain anonymous, but I am a Hilton Diamond member that always stays at The Hilton Costa Mesa for work.  I am there many days out of the year and always have exceptional service. Ashley used to work at the front desk and she is truely missed! The entire staff is great but Ashley seemed to go beyond her means to accomodate me. I usually email her my schedule so she can take care of my reservations. I have only given the responsibility to her and she always comes through, even though its not her department any longer. Just wanted to say thank you and I hope she gets the recognition she deserves!
Manager Response: Dear Lil Beach Babe, It is always a pleasure to receive positive comments about our team and our property but when it comes from a Hilton Diamond member it is extra special. It is a joy that you too recognize our team member Ashley and see why she was promoted within our property to Events and Catering. We look forward to serving you again in the future and thank you. Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: Whenever I'm visiting Costa Mesa, my first choice has always been Hilton; whether it's for a business trip or just to relax. I loved Hilton Costa Mesa because it is located next to South Coast Plaza, accessible to a lot of shopping and fine dining. My last visit might change that, unfortunately. The rooms are always very clean and comfortable. The restaurant and bar has great food and drinks. What has changed drastically during my visit was the service I received at the Front Desk. Usually, there is a very nice, helpful staff present, but I'm not sure what happened. The young girl with the braces who helped me check in was clearly in a bad mood, was very unpleasant, and seemed as if she didn't know what she was doing. I called for extra pillows and towels twice before they were
Manager Response: Dear Shark Fan23, We at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa want to thank you for your review. It is only through feedback we can become better and our goal is always to exceed each of our guest‚Äôs expectations. We have sat with our front office team and shared your feedback and they understand the importance of friendliness to ever guest every time in the minimum requirement for their roles. I am glad that you enjoyed your room, your food and beverage experience and the other departments of the hotel and hope you give us an opportunity to regain your confidence. Thank you, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: NIce hotel - well priced compared to those nearby
Summary: Managed to secure a walk in rate at the last minute, after reviewing my options closer to the beach. Nice room, no outlook, freindly staff, and not too far from facilities.   Not a place for a holiday, but if you need to be in the OC (as I did) its well accomodated
Manager Response: Dear Kirk Muddle, Always great to see a review from Australia, we are lucky to have many Australian guests and even have Australian sports channels on our TV's in the bar and Pizza bar area. Thank you for your review and we hope to see you back in the OC soon. Brian Keys  Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Never again...worst hotel staff and service ever
Summary: This hotel is passable at best.  The hallways, rooms and elevators smell very damp and musty and were not very clean.  The rate was fairly low, so it's a get what you pay for situation.  Most deplorable of all though; this hotel was loaded with call-girls in the hallways and the lobby on a Tuesday night  (I'm not naive, I know this happens at hotels but the management here obviously has an overt problem and needs to take action to clean this up and they have not).  The service is where this stay really fell apart.  After I checked out things got down right ugly.  The hotel had billed my bank card 4 times for the same stay (6 days).  On top of that they also billed another one of my cards for the full stay!  I had over $4100.00 in holds on my bank card (the one that was not even
Manager Response: Dear Markalanhill,  Let me begin by offering my sincere apologies that we were unable to meet your expectations. Our goal at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa is to exceed the expectations of our guests.We will use your feedback and share with our teams to make sure that we deliver on that promise consistently.  Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for one night and had a good time here. Checkin was fast and room was clean, specious and very nice. Easily my favorite hotel in the area and will come back!
Manager Response: Dear Boomstar, We at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa would like to thank you for your kind review.  I hope to have the opportunity to thank you in person in the future.  Regards,  Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, perfect for a business meeting or conference
Summary: Traveled solo for a work conference in August 2010. Great space for meetings, room was decent, exceptionally clean, restaurant and bar was lively and had good food. The multi-tier pool is also a fun place to be. The exercise facility is very nice and has a great selection of equipment. Hotel is right down the street from the OC mall - must check it out!
Manager Response: Dear Bweezy,  We at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa would like to thank you for your positive review.  I will make sure to share your comments with our team. I hope to have the opportunity in the near future to thank you in person.  Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General manager

Summary Heading: Nice location but water damaged room
Summary: Nice location near South Coast Plaza, but room had moldy smell and water damage on bathroom door.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amidst Chaos, the bar was great
Summary: I was visiting the Hilton in Costa Mesa to visit with some friends who were there. We decided to get some beers down in the bar and finish watching the New Mexico BYU game (which we unfortunately lost). Just need to send shoutouts to HUNG our awesome bartender. Kind and courteous. Great service. and makes a killer martini. I work in the industry and am critical of everything.
Manager Response: Dear David,  We at the Hilton Orange County Costa Mesa would like to thank you for your positive feedback. We are sorry that we could not make your team win but we are delighted that Hung was able to look after you in such a kind and courteous way. I have already thanked Hung for doing such a great job and haved tried to get his Martini recipe, to no avail. Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: The Hilton Orange County is a good business, traveler hotel.  Stay here often.  Close to commercial area, the airport, and Gold Coast Mall..  Good bar/restaurant in the lobby and fitness room.
Manager Response: Dear GS_VA12, We are delighted her that you enjoyed the hotel and location of our property. We hope to be able to serve you again in the future. Regards, Brian Keys Assistant General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. Overall I had a good stay. I wasn't blown away but the hotel served its purpose. The cleaning staff was very nice and everyone that I encountered was very friendly and helpful. The shuttle drivers were also very accommodating and we enjoyed our trip to the South Coast Plaza Mall. The food in the hotel was also very good.   However, my room smelled like an old smoking room that they were trying to pass as a non-smoking room. My room also faced the highway and with the trucks and cars I was woken up very early. Overall it is a nice hotel to stay on business but for leisure I would not recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Having read the prior reviews, I can honestly say that there's no pleasing some people. Yes, this is an older property. Yes, the parking fee sucks. But for the rate ($77/night on hotwire plus $20/night parking), you get a fairly spacious, quiet (we had neighbors on both sides snd did not hear them at all) room in a well maintained (carpets had just been replaced throughout the hotel) property w/ a very professional staff that is close to shopping, good restaurants and entertainment. It's not a W or trendy boutique hotel, but neither are you paying $250/night. This hotel properly reflects the quality implicit in the Hilton brand. For the complainers, get a life -- picking nits instead of appreciating value received is unproductive. Of course, if I had paid closer to $200/night, I
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked an Executive room this time, but was disappointed that the Executive Lounge was closed. Instead of the lounge I received complimentary in-room internet and a $10 discount in the gift shop.. Staff is friendly and helpful as always, and the rooms are spacious and clean. I keep coming back for the great location. It's close to South Coast Plaza Shopping Resort and just a short drive to Newport Beach and Orange County Airport.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A 1970s Atrium Hyatt morphed into an average Hilton
Summary: The hotel's rooms are fully competitive with other mid-priced, 3 to3 1/2 star chains- nothing more, nothing less.  You have been in the building before- it is a stock plan, suburban Hyatt from 1974, a look that hasn't aged well.  Everything is clean and the staff is polite and, yes, South Coast Plaza is a stone's throw away.  It does the job without glaring faults.  Was it a treat to stay there?  No.  I would not object if someone booked me there again, but left to my own initiative, I would look for a better option.  The bed had a brand new, cheap, rock hard mattress (NOT Hilton's much-promoted wonder mattress) that made for less than comfortable sleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel But Parking is EXPENSIVE!!
Summary: The hotel was great. The rooms were decent. The layout and decor was nice. The staff was great. Overall great experience.  My biggest complaint is parking. At $21/day parking, it stacks up!   I mean come on. It's Orange County. Not downtown LA or Chicago.  Unacceptable!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is decent but make sure you get a good room. we got a dark room with an awful view of the elevator!   but other than that it was worth the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value if you can get a bargain rate
Summary: I got an incredibly low rate on Priceline.com for this hotel. The rooms were really nice, clean and appeared renovated. Beds were comfortable. I always frown on hotels that charge for internet in the rooms but the reality is that most of them charge in-room. However, it's free in the lobby which was a big +.  The bar area is really nice and the TVs were large and HD quality. They have a wood burning oven pizza place in the hotel too that we tried. Pretty good. Had their breakfast buffet as well that was obviously overpriced but decent but not a lot of selection.  The parking was annoying because it is $21/night for self-park. I tried to look to see if there was street parking but there are no other options except to pay the hotel parking.  I would definitely stay here again if I
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was duped!  I booked through Priceline and was looking for a 4 star hotel near Anaheim. This hotel is NOT a 4 star!  The wallpaper was peeling from the walls, the beds were rocks with thick pads put on top!  The people at the desk were really nice and gave us a different room from what we had originally booked, but it was not an upgrade.  Even though we didn't use it, the pool looked nice. If I had to give this hotel a star rating, it would be 3, but the name Hilton is attached and that pushed it up and over.  NOT IMPRESSED! Would not stay again.  Parking is $20/day as well... I guess California gets you to pay wherever they can.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best hotel at best price and quality
Summary: Great upper class hotel facility with all amenities needed.  Staff is very helpful.  Location is great for CA visitor and or shoppers or even business.  Company's contracted rate and free parking helped, HHonor program's free breakfast and internet were truly helpful to make the trip and cost estimates more predictable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my second stay at Hilton Costa Mesa. The service is immaculate. My 4 year-old daughter didn't want to leave and asked if we can move to live here.  The pool is heated and the jacuzzi is great. Check-in and check-out is quick and smooth.   We attend the show at Hilton so we get parking validated at $8/day. If you don't want to pay for parking, just park nearby hotel near Mitsuwa Marketplace. It is free.   For internet, you can use internet at McDonald across the streey at no charge. I will be back here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this property many times in the 1980s when it was part of the Red Lion chain.  Amazingly, not a lot has changed in 25 years.  Check-in was great.  The front desk staff were superb throughout our visit. But that is the best I can say.  The property itself is very dated. And while "clean," it showed it's age and not in a nice way. I've seen this rated as a four-star property -- not by my standards.  It's a solid three-star and not a speck above.  Two major irritations. You have to pay for internet service.  Yep, that's right. No free wi-fi, although some people suggest going to the McDonald's across the street for that. LOL.  Also, their business center also charges an outrageous rate for internet use, although you can print boarding passes for free.  Very poor in my
Manager Response: none

Summary: The first thing you notice about the rather nondescript Costa Mesa Hilton is its superb staff. Whatever the owners are not spending on updates and such, they must (or should) be spending on personnel... from the front desk clerk to the bellman; from the parking garage attendant to the sales staff, I had not a single less-than-excellent experience.   My room, while large, relatively clean and quiet, is in need of an update. The new LG TV was great, but has become pretty standard for rooms in this rate class. The 30+ year-old in-room HVAC system began emanating a high-pitched whine at some point, and nothing short of in-ear buds would get rid of the on and off noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dirty Underwear and cigarette butts outside of my window!
Summary: This hotel is rated 4 stars.  It should be a 3 star hotel.  The lobby and bar are very nice.  I got in to my dark room to find the TV dresser duct taped together.  The refrigerator was just randomly sitting out by itself not in a cabinet.  I opened my window treatments to look at the view and found my window was the roof top with dirty boxers and cigarette butts everywhere!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hilton hotel, location even better.
Summary: Stayed at the Hilton Costa Mesa in July for a week. We had a early flight from Sydney and arraived around 11am and checked in. On first impression the hotel is clean, staff friendly and found the self parking easy which is now $21 a day. The parking is secure and most levels are covered but can eat into your budget with the cost. Pool area is nice and we went in a few times over the week. Rooms are good sized and have flat screens. Hotel is very close to John Wayne and major highways.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our check-in process was smooth. The staff person was very good about getting a room that we asked for: high floor, away from the elevator, two beds, and with a view. Everything was as expected from a Hilton and the food was good. Our check out process was also smooth. My wife and I plan to return next year. This is a short review because the accommodation and overall experience was what I've come to expect from a Hilton. Just plain solid overall.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family checked in at the Hilton on July 31st.  We were immediately checked in.  Unlike other reviewers, we had no trouble finding the self-park.  Our rooms were clean, comfortable, and conveniently located to the South Coast Mall, beach, and restaurants.  We wanted a place that would be about 1/2 way between LA and San Diego.  This fit the bill perfectly.  There are no safes in the room, so we had a security box by the front desk.  Everyday the young lady at the front desk would ask us where we were going that particular day and give helpful hints or provide maps to get us there.  Tiffany was a wonderful resource and saved us time and money!  All of the front desk staff was extremely helpful, but Tiffany went the extra mile!  The pool was great after a long day.  My kids
Manager Response: none

Summary: My only gripe was that I had to go looking for what I had paid for. it took 3 attempts to finally get the room i had booked. This all went wrong when I tried to confirm at checkin what I felt I had booked. The clerk told me not at that rate! I had booked and prepaid an executive floor room which came with breakfast and a few other upgrades.First of all I was given a standard room, then I was given a standard room with breakfast, then they got it right. All this took 2 hours and left me with a bad feeling about the place. The operations director did apologise and this was appreciated, and it is for that reason that I would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review! Your feedback is important to us as we make the best decisions for the current and future guests of the hotel.  We are sorry to hear about your check-in experience and apologize for the inconvenience.  We are glad to hear that you would stay with us again and I can assure you would not be disappointed.
